document: an inspiring movie hello love goodbye, despite being a largely feel good film, did not shy away from the harsh realities that its ofw audience experiences despite being upfront with the struggles of an ofw, it still serves as a gentle, hopeful reminder for our modern day heroes to not forget to choose themselves to not forget that they can allow themselves to dream, to love, and most of all, to be human it show that love can wait but our dreams it knock once like opportunity grab it once it came in your or our life kathryn bernardo portrays joy's exhaustion, anger and resolution so potently without much words it all comes out in the way her lids look heavy from a two hour sleep how her shoulders slump as she grapples with the thought of her agonizingly routine life we see it in her quiet moments in the night when she can catch a few minutes just to stare blankly at the wall the depiction felt authentic and tugs at your heartstrings, joy is the symbol of women with dream and also her leading man this is a more mature role for alden as well, and the material lets him show a deeper side to his acting chops his character's personal story carried as much weight as the romance, and in ethan's vulnerable moments, we see alden as a dramatic actor, and not just a tutti frutti leading man that's not to say that he didn't play the charismatic boyfriend role well, though the kilig factor we as always cranked up to high, thanks also to his and kathryn's organic chemistry the most unforgettable scene in this movie when ethan and joy decided to leave each other to continue their dream and when ethan said will you give the rest of your time with me in hong kong those line make me sad and overwhelmed because even they know that they leave each other they choose to understand and make those little time to make memorable, they choose to spent those time to be happy this movie make us inspired that life is like a photography, we developed from negative

love is about letting go not sacrifice i've seen a few of kathryn bernardo's films, and i believe she turned in the performance of her life she stepped away from the typical romantic comedies many of which are actually quite good , and challenged herself to take on the role of a much deeper and much more complex character in joy i have always marveled and not in a good way of how people tend to use others even people they love even members of their own families of course, children are usually guilted into it in short, it's a parent's way of saying, i suffered, and so now you must suffer too because it's how families work as stated in other reviews, i am an esl teacher i've lived and worked in south korea, china, and taiwan i know quite a bit about how asian parents tend to treat their kids you'll scarcely find parents who are more dedicated to teaching their children about discipline and hard work the large contrast between them and western parents, is that western parents tend to allow their kids to do whatever they want they're spoiled beyond belief what is needed is a balance as the eldest daughter, joy is in hong kong working several jobs in order to keep herself alive as well as sending money back home to her family in the phillippines she has a nursing degree her dream is to go to canada to pursue what she loves of course, she meets and falls in love with ethan, a young man who is also from the phillippines, who is trying to support his family as well, after a disastrous relationship that nearly cost him everything ethan, of course, is hoping that joy will decide to stay in hong kong, and not go to canada this is when the film really grabs the viewer to see what joy will decide to do love is not about sacrifice for someone else sacrifice is about losing something, and love is never about loss it's always about who you are in all her wisdom, joy has to explain this to ethan as well as outlining the consequences of not pursuing her dream fortunately, ethan finally gets it and is able to do what only love can do let go some can do it in the end, you can only truly look after yourself and not lose sight of your own dreams if you forge ahead, then you have gained more profound wisdom about life than what most people can only dream about my only complaint of the film was that the chemistry between kathryn bernardo and alden richards was not what it should have been i'd say it was pretty obvious that kathryn bernardo did not want to do any kissing scenes with alden due to her love and respect for her boyfriend, daniel padilla the only kiss we see is one on her forehead in the dark i couldn't help but wonder how much more powerful the film would have been if another actress had performed in the role, or if padilla himself hadn't turned the role down which i read that he had still, this is a memorable film that challenges everyone to go after their dreams and let nothing and no one stand in your way

what a nice surprise of a movie right, well i didn't really know what i was getting into here when i sat down to watch the 2019 tagalog movie that was filmed in hong kong and given my fascination with asian movie, of course i sat down to watch hello, love, goodbye and i must definitely say that writers carmi raymundo, cathy garcia molina and ronalisa a co came up with a rather enthralling storyline one that definitely provided as much of entertainment and enjoyment, as it was a movie that was very watchable and likeable the storyline is one that easily sways away the audience, because it is wholehearted and nicely told storyline and milling about in the storyline are some nicely detailed and interesting characters so a big thumbs up to the writers on this accomplishment i will say that the acting in the movie was good now, i am not overly familiar with tagalog cinema, but my wife told me that there were some rather famous tagalog actresses and actors in the movie nevertheless, i think the acting performances were spot on at the same time, with providing a good story and good entertainment, hello, love, goodbye really brought me back to my four years of living and working in hong kong this movie stoked so many memories and definitely spurred a desire to return to hong kong to revisit that fabulous place if you like romantic movies, then i strongly believe that the 2019 movie hello, love, goodbye from director cathy garcia molina is a movie that you will thoroughly enjoy i was more than genuinely entertained by this movie, and it is a movie that i can warmly recommend you sit down to watch my rating of hello, love, goodbye lands on a well deserved seven out of ten stars

hello, love, no goodbyes being the highest grossing philippine movie thus far, i hope you don't mind if i came into watching this with high expectations still i was skeptic because the assumption was it will be another one of those formulaic star cinema movie starring kathryn bernardo, directed by cathy molina garcia, set in an international location, usual love story but with a twist we get a new boy this time in the form of alden richards for the most part i was right, it was all you could ever expect from the same group that gave us the highest grossing movie the year before, 'how's of us ' amidst it's shortcomings, 'hello, love, goodbye' is a pleasant surprise for a movie who's theme has been done a million times part of it's success can be attributed to showing us the reality of our hardworking domestic helpers in hong kong which the ofw community all over the world related and responded to and it did not give us the usual ending we are used to, which makes a sequel possible seeing as all three already expressed interest in doing the story was well written for the most part and my favorite was the start of the movie it was a different approach, fast paced and intriguing while at some point it had to slow down to become what it really was meant to be in the first place, a typical pinoy love story, at least it introduced something new to the audience that can be the new norm in the future acting wise, kathryn and alden both delivered but both lacked maturity which i'm hoping can be improved on once the sequel rolls around it took a while for their chemistry to kick in, possibly a result of being pigeonholed in their respective love teams for a long time kathryn can act, but she has certain mannerisms when she deliver some of her lines that breaks my concentration from her acting i'm still getting rich girl even though she's supposed to be covered in filth from hiding under a pile of garbage bags alden still comes from the john lloyd cruz school for acting, but as soon as he develops his own signature he should be destined for greater things the supporting cast did what was required of them, with maxine medina and jameson blake as highlights there's always the burden of asking whether this is the movie that will propel philippine cinema back to it's old glory obviously this is not it, but delightfully it's not a step back as well knowing this specific tandem and formula works, hopefully everyone involved will be more keen on wanting to elevate the viewing experience the second time around i keep harping on this because i honestly believe it has the potential to become even more special than what they've already done here

truly amazing this is so far, the best filipino movie of 2019 i really love the story, which shows a lot about the lives of filipino workers in hong kong this will make you laugh out loud a lot and cry hard for me this is cathy garcia molina's best movie kathryn and alden really shines in this, great acting by the whole cast it also has great shots, cinematography and soundtrack so it is a must watch

mature and bold love story the two stars from the two different stations hit it off with good chemistry in this mature love story although the story is as typical as any filipino love romance movie could be, i like the fact that the writer and director went for the bold path of ending the movie with goodbye , instead of coming up with an epilogue that let the two lovers meet again in some future the two lead stars are engaging enough for you to care what happens to them in the end but there are some parts where it could drag still, i can understand the clamor when this movie came out in 2019

the best filipino movie ever this is the best pinoy movie ever the characters are superb kathryn bernardo and alden richards performance was the best there is no boring moments in the movie it's a must watch for everyone kathryn bernardo played the role of joy a filipino worker in hong kong who is struggling and doing odd jobs to take care of her family on the other hand alden richards played the role of ethan a funny and unserious bartender who later crossed path with joy and the story of their undying love begins the story is not just another pinoy love story it's a story that shows the struggle of all ofw i was touched and move by the acting of kathryn bernardo and alden richards they made it possible for me to relate with the movie i'm not a filipino but i was able to get every piece of the movie because of their wonderful onscreen chemistry kudos to the cast and crew good job director molina i wouldn't mind to travel again for the part 2 of this movie it's worth my time and my money more movies for this duos please i would always travel with my family to watch their movie onscreen more movies for kathryn bernardo and alden richards please they've won my heart
kathryn alden seemed too rehearsed and some of their co actors were really annoying save your money and just watch this on netflix or cinema one when it airs

a simple mirror this is another cheese pinoy movie, but base in real life, that is the point, at the end family is not the principal role, a twisted end, a lot of lacrimogen bomb, good for the family but pinoy is the new korean drama
great movie its an eye opener to some of the facing problems of ofw

time must start again 7 7 vg timing in life is everything so the adage goes in hong kong, time is gld as long as you move you'll live over 200,000 filipinos work in hong kong it's most common to have a 2 yr domestic helper contract as filipinos are not allowed to do anything else unless they manage to become a citizen the cops, inevitably, will come by to check ids when joy sees them, she busts a move and runs she ends up running right into the handsome bartender and busts another move she uses him as camouflage to hide from the po po cops rarely bother a couple snogging in the alleyway, afterall it's done so often in movies you might think that they would start checking, even if a duo is rounding first and headed for second, but it always seems to work everyone is within 1 of separation, but it's large enough to support a filipino radio station they have a nifty microeconomic system in place as well joy thinks she got away scott free only to wake up the next morning to a radio announcement about her ethan, the bartender, is looking for joy so that she can return the kiss that she stole from him joy's friends go insane hlg is about what decent, but poor, people must do to survive it is all about hard choices it is also about the nature of love joy ethan ethan joy she resists him, but she can't for long she's going to be a nurse in canada nt a thing budkis pistza larkaflark nuffink jack squat natty joy is no wimp she has a will of iron she warns ethan to not get attached yet they allow themselves to fall in love every day they push the knife in a little deeper their story is sweet and these protags are likable he says he can handle it and he won't get in her way, but as that approaches the pressure ratchets up because, 'when you love, it's all or nothing if you hold back, then why love it all ' ethan has a point 'there are questions inside of me that only i can answer,' joy insists joy has goals, a mission, and an ironclad agenda what does it look like to ethan it's if you loved me enough you would stay to joy it's if you loved me enough you would want me to go later, joy asks the universe when a woman gives too much of herself, she's stupid, but when she prioritizes herself, she's bad is love only expressed through sacrifice love can teeter from selfish to selfless perhaps love always starts down in the selfish zone, but the more we sincerely love someone, the more selfless we should become leaving the shallow end and diving down deeper should elevate our love higher if not, we must question how much in we are or how selfish we actually are a young person should never be expected to throw away h h future for a relationship, particularly a relatively new one joy agonizes over this unexpected timeout from the race she's been running either option is valid her choice is hers alone hlg tells young girls that their personal development and future is every bit as important as love befitting a modest budget, most of the filming is on the street or in contained spaces there's a couple of wow shots they take a day off to go up into the mountains on a cliff looking down on the city, the buildings are uniformly white while they look like bad dental work there's also an ethereal beauty to the vista hlg is a 118 minute, 2019 release that is rated 8 2 on mdl overall, this is a well put together production the writing, directing and acting all blend to make a great product with few flaws this is a filipino production and i am looking forward to seeing more of their works i've seen 2 hong kong productions, the defected 8 2 and hong kong west side stories 7 both of them are good but also dark, edgy, sad, and a display of the worst elements of humanity the group that is the most downtrodden in hong kong seems to have a brighter outlook hlg is well worth the time to get a peek at life in hong kong from the view of the hard working, overlooked filipino community we have alot to be thankful for imho 78 72 79 70 67 71 best filipino love story movie this movie is almost 90 accurate when it comes to portraying ofw life in china acting is very good and i never expected that kath and alden would have a good chemistry

i wish that her writers and directors would gave her something different worthy of famas or urian award, she deserves it, it was just the material that always failed her the story could have been very good to tell, but it was the storytelling that seems to be ordinary and safe but at the end of the day, it makes you feel something and that is what filipino films are good at

superb acting and story kathryn and alden gave justice to their characters you'll forget that these are actors just portraing roles because they portrayed their characters so well the chemistry between these two is overflowing these movie is not just a love story, it's a life story it tells you the life of overseas filipino worker abroad, the struggle that they have to go through to achieve their goals for themselves and thier family

hello, love, goodbye unexpected chemistry of kathryn bernardo and alden richards they successfully portrayed their characters the plot of the story is great and we want more great job team hlg part2 please

pretty great finally, no cheesy cliche filipino romance in here it's a great start for hollywood esque films it even has lessons like remember to care for your family and how to love someone purely how much ofws work hard just to provide for their family and how other people should appreciate that the best one is 'i love you but this time, i love myself more '

what the world needs real emotion, it gives you a glimpse of what its like to be an ofw worker, more so being a domestic helper teaching one that inorder for you to love others, you need to love yourself first you need to choose your own happiness

alden richards' character, ethan, is pushy, creepy and problematic ethan will continue sending friend requests even if joy declined several times already he will make the radio station talk about joy in public without her permission he will use another phone to text joy anonymously he will act like a police even if joy is weeping out of fear he will squeeze through inside a small room knowing that joy will be uncomfortable he will continually send need a friend today text messages even if joy has rejected it so many times 'hello, love, goodbye' is at its best when it tells the story of kathryn bernardo's character, joy in some ways, the film manages to outdo similar mainstream filipino romance films because of kathryn bernardo's stunning performance and the earnest depiction of ofws bernardo, whose acting holds the film together when it was falling apart, effectively evokes a palpable sense of weariness, discontent, and eagerness to alleviate joy's situation actually, i can do without the 'la la land' love story if the social commentary was strengthened and expounded more in a similar vein with 'sunday beauty queen,' the film resonates with filipinos because of its sensible portrayal of what it is like to work abroad in a job you are overqualified in sure, this is how cliche ridden mainstream filipino romance plays out but how i wish we get movies that transcend this generic romantic stratagem

best of 2019 this is by far the first movie of alden richards that i watched at first, it was just an attempt to like the tandem of kath and alden but it turned out to be an affirmation of their chemistry i was moved and even shed some tears even in scenes where not much is expected simple conversations that will make you fall into tears very touching movie it's actually about love in general and that includes love of family

it was the most best movie of alden and kathryn i ever watched this not just a love story it was more than a love story its story of dreams that we need to see how far we can go and nothing can stop us even love and i salute all filipinos who works hard and conquered other countries for their families we absolutely need a second part in this one i don't really into in filipino movies it was my first local movie i watched in 2019

much love i would love to watch this over and over again i love the film all in general i was so speechless, so please help your self to witness this movie it's not your typical love story but it was a real life of an ofw that working hard

a story highlighting selfless love and sacrifice breathe of freshness on screen, we've been served with a platter of good offering, ar's gentleman antics and kb's toughness and complexity complements each other's character just right, a movie that highlights the life,pain and sufferings of filipino working abroad especially hongkong an eye opener about the common misconceptions about the life of our modern day heroes the brave ofws another masterpiece from direct cathy garcia molina for mixing out the reality of life abroad, stories of risk takers the dreamers sacrifice selfless love

it depicts a few of the many instances of what ofws experience while working abroad the chemistry happened between the viewers and alden kathryn, but not between the characters themselves i haven't talked about the problems with the other casts i would have felt better if i just watched the film anak with the other ofws in one of the film's scenes

this isnt just one of those sappy romance stories, no, it covers real life topics i assume about filipinos foreign workers, immigration etc i gotta admit that i never really think twice about these things but this movie makes me feel the pain we just gotta be grateful of choices we have in life some people have it harder now, kathryn joy is such an amazing actress i can almost relate to everything shes going through in the movie and oh, prepare tissues cause youre gonna need em

a movie with a heart hello goodbye love what a beautifully made movie, what a wonderful message for the millennials great story by ms carmi raymundo, great directing by cathy garcia molina, great acting by both main actors, ms kathryn bernardo and mr alden richards as well as the supporting actors the movie focuses on the life of joy, a filipino nurse graduate who works instead as a dh domestic helper in hong kong the crux of the film shows how ofws overseas filipino worker live in other countries for me, the love story between the characters was secondary but it was the right touch to bind things together kathryn is most beautiful bare faced and delivers a great performance a must see movie

a filipino movie that you should watch this is by far the best filipino movie of 2019 and one of the best of all time there's no waste or boring moment this movie sets the new benchmark for filipino movie a must watch and highly recommended

it's unique by itself, highly recommended a must watch film it's unique by itself, highly recommended a must watch film alden ethan and kathryn joy brings spice to a good story i can tell that its a masterpiece love the movie part 2 please

worth watching, good story not a fan of the 2 lead actors, but i can say that they did a good job portraying the characters in this movie cinematography is good the 2 leads have chemistry despite them not being paired at all before the story, most especially the ending part, makes it worth watching good overall and probably the best filipino movie among the others during that time, however, it is similar to the other mainstream filipino movies
please do the part 2 falling in love with the whole story and the actor mixed feelings but i need the second please do the part 2 please don't stop making great story like this

a must watch movie i highly recommend this movie to everyone this is not your ordinary rom com movie that will just give you smile and love this is a realistic movie where you'll see the life of a filipino ofw in hongkong the sacrifices and dreams for the family but love will always come at the least expected time kathryn bernardo never failed me to amaze on her acting skills she always devote herself into the character and put amazing life onto it i must say that i'm a fan alden richards on the other hand surprises me on his hotness throughout the whole movie these two characters made my heart cry and leaving me to re watch again the movie that feeling you have when you finish an amazing movie that you don't want it to end director cathy is a genius on her craft she knows how to perfectly put drama, romance and comedy into a single movie everyone must watch this movie this movie will teach or remind us to love yourself, love your family, follow your dreams, live your life to the fullest until you have time, true love will set you free, and the list goes on

honest review nothing special about the movie's plot except the best performance from kathryn and alden maybe because i couldn't relate to the movie but kathryn and alden was so great they make the ordinary story extraordinary and don't forget the kilig factor alden brought up on some scenes overall, not a waste of money

honest review why 5 lets start with how great kathryn's acting is as expected from her the hows of us piece alden did ok wasn't expecting much but it was a solid performance however his acting reminds me of john lloyd but in this movie it's neither then again a solid one now, the lines they are trying to squeeze the hugots absolutely anywhere they want in the film go watch it again, you'll see the same style of focus and switch to subject over and over again there are many scenes that could've shot with them both in the frame to show their emotions at the same time it was like action and my 11 yr old daughter even agreed how bad the shots are compare this with tadhana, 100 na tula, kita kita, the day after valentines, never not love you, and walangforever if you havent seen these, go watch them and thank me later 5 is because of kathryn

just wow in what may be cathy garcia molina's best movie to date, this movie overcomes the banal and stereotypical nuances pinoy romcoms are known for in fact the apparent filipino diaspora is the true backdrop of this movie the ensuing love story merely serves as extravagance but will eventually turn complimentary to the already palatable storyline of kathryn bernardo's plight as a struggling domestic helper torn between the choice of staying in hongkong to be with the man she loves alden richards and fulfilling her destiny to be a succesful nurse in canada both characters are vibrant and played to a t by the two lead actors but that stockroom scene is just plain fun and genius the chemistry between the two characters made apparent by screams of excitement from my neighboring seat as the pair locked eyes for the first time forget about the common adequacy pinoy films are usually associated with we may suck in action and sci fi movies but we can definitely make quality films in other genres like this one again, this is not a paid ad
nice love story with great story lines my first time watching filipina romantic love story the storyline was pretty engaging it keeps you watching all the way great acting and scenes as well
great movie great acting skills of alden, warms the heart despite struggles working abroad

it's not hollywood, but for a pinoy style movie , this is ver good after watching the movie, i just have love everything about it the feeling of missing the characters after the movie ended goodvibes, inside the cinema, it is so nice to hear people having mixed emotions throughout the entire movie, nakakakilig, nakakatawa, nakakaiyak it's not heavy , just simple kathryn's voice is just perfect for her role she has a straight face but she managed to give expressions that justifies every line she says, thru her eyes you will love her more in this movie alden has an expressive face, can portray a sad eyes and happy smile at the same time with that expressive face, i was amazed that he made me smile and laugh with those supposedly cheesy lines of the script i did not expect that he is this good he actually can shift from happy to sad to serious without you noticing the transition plus he is so manly and handsome many women inside the cinema were so 'kilig' everytime his face shows up especially upclose the supporting cast will give you a break to the story of joy and ethan, they are very funny i meant, just their presence adds excitement they are the ones who completed the movie good choice of names of the lead actors joy is a name that is nice to hear from alden's voice ethan could be alden's alternative name in real life, it suits him well and mary dale is maymay's real name, very filipino and youthful name for her character great chemistry, ethan's arms looks so comfy everytime he hugs joy when they look at each other in the eyes, it's genuine alden's bubbly voice and joy's serious voice are blending nicely that is why just them sitting and talking brings kilig you can see hongkong itself, even in just a glimpse you can see the unity of filipinos being an ofw is hard but having to see a community of filipino around you brings comfort and home some parts are like music videos, maybe because the music is so good to hear in those hongkong buildings in the background direk cathy is really exeptional she will bring out the best in all actors she choses the best on everything the movie itself tells different stories in just 2 hours all stories are true to life, but hopeful all stories are aspiring to have a better life and chasing happiness in order to chase happiness, you should make sacrifices, but making sacrifices is not sad at all the whole movie is not korean or hollywood, but filipino there is always room for improvement but that improvement, we should make movies more like filipino style it is very simple actually but filipinos are loving it because it is very light, its for family bonding you wont feel awkward watching it with your grandparents i gave it 10 over 10 because i cant get over it

it's an ok film story it's good but there is some strained scene just to make the story long extend actor ethan alden richards he's acting skills is amendable there's some blunt moments in his facial acts actress joy kathryn bernardo no doubt a great actress cinematography great beautifulyl shot

personal bakstori napanood ko 'to nang d maayos dati sa tv kasama pa ata mga relatives ko and everybody was talking like nasa bg lng tlg sha yung typical na pag may bisita d nakafocus sa tv pang background noise lang tas titingin lng from time 2 time not full focus lmao pero i remember it catching my attention and i remember telling myself na gusto ko siya mapanood properly someday well that someday came hahahareal review starts here goods naman sha for me tbh ang galing ng acting omfgggggggg stellar performance s i remember may nadaanan akong interview niya saying how hard everything was for her shooting this but it really shows how everything paid off galing niya dito sobra, ito rin ata first big thing na wala ung so glad for that decision na iba ung nagplay opposite her anyway lov the side characs na besties too super natural kaya what i can say about this movie is the best thing about it are the performances talaga iba pagkakadeliver nila and appreciate ko rin naman how it showcase ung buhay ng mga kababayan natin and presents conflicts not just with work but also with family and self and dreams maraming natouch na topics tong film na 'to dialouge medyo naooff minsan and may mga questionable talaga na sinabi at actions ang mga characters lalo na kay alden bwahahah tho i think it makes it more realistic and humanizes the characters even more i'm just so glad with how they wrote kath's character din and how she stood her ground yas queeen and may mga binatong linya na kabog din naman talaga couple of gag worthy quotes pero minsan sumosobra na it doesnt sound authentic na ung flow hahaha pero saks lng kaya kahit pumapalya sa mga certain areas andon parin yung tatak pinoy the humor lmao so i appreciate it and most of all i actually enjoyed it so its worth the watch and my time kahit d siya fully formed story and may mga shallow problematic areas talaga i'll let this one slide bc enjoyable paren tbh kita ko bakit patok sa mainstream

gets ko yung reasons ni joy and ni ethan kung ano pinanghuhugutan nila sa actions nila gets ko yung lalim ng pagmamahal ni ethan gets ko rin yung lalim ng pangarap ni joy a good movie indeed for someone na ginagawa ang lahat para sa mas maayos na future
i can say this is one of the best filo movie out there this is also the last movie that i watched inside a cinema before pandemic so yeah

i really love how theyve shown the lives of the ofws their sacrifices, silent battles, and the longing that comes with being miles away from home one of the main reasons why i chose this as the film subject for my discourse analysis in grade 11 but above all, theyve shown us a story about choosing yourself and all that you have to go through to do that and joy was such a great protagonist for this because how can you love someone so much, and still have to let them go to choose yourself all her life, she had to put others first before herself, giving up and sacrificing things for people but when the time came that she finally decided to choose herself, she wasnt being selfish she was finally being free i admire her so much for having the courage to leave, to allow herself to grow and dream and ethan its a hard pill to swallow, but its the truth the reality that not all the love in the world can save us joy was never lacking in reminding him that shes going to leave she never made false promises, never painted a forever she couldnt give it was he who pushed himself into her life, even when she kept on pushing him away i know that ethan just hoped its not a bad thing but sometimes, hope blinds us from the truth we already know, making her choose between the dream shes been working hard for and the love she never expected to find so yup, joy, tama ka sa sinabi mong, kung mahal mo ko, bakit pinapapili mo ako at sana, makahanap tayong lahat ng taong hindi tayo papipiliin tulad ni ethan

not the most life altering piece of cinema but definitely the most modern filipino movie that i'm proud of so far rip to kathniel but also not because kathryn bernardo and these other actors deserve to have their spotlight and be taken srsly as actors instead of being forced into a loveteam from an early age still loved their movies together but this was definitely a huge risk in the filipino entertainment industry and im glad they delivered obviously still has its fair share of red flag romanticism for the leading man but as alwayssssss the filipina baddie carries but just knowing how the usual filipino rom coms go, this was already breaking tradition, while still managing to deliver the kilig factors i love that the ending is up to interpretation, and kathryn still pursues her career as a nurse very bold choices against the usual filipino movie plot lines its a good love story, the chemistry is there, and also love how it mixes in the harsh realities of working abroad and the hard working filipino spirit they were in hong kong though,, so the shots could have been way prettier cinematically but props to the director and the casting, kathryn bernardo always has my heart and i cant wait to see her in more movies alden is alright too im just pretending the sequel doesnt exist

i appreciate this movie for showing a glimpse into the life of an ofw working as a domestic helper, and for highlighting the reality that many of them hold degrees that could qualify them for opportunities far beyond the jobs and salaries theyre stuck with kathryn nailed her roleher character felt real and easy to sympathize with ethan wanted joy to stay because, for the first time since his breakup with tanya, he felt like he had purpose againsomething he found in helping joyand he didnt want to let that go

joy, a hardworking domestic helper, and ethan, a charming bartender, fall in love while working overseas in hong kong it's a fairly grounded love story that reminds us that sometimes love means letting go kathryn bernardo, as joy, carried the film for me as she is forced to choose between love and following her dreams, capturing the quiet resilience of countless filipinos abroad we also get to see the emotional toll, economic pressures, and social sacrifices ofws face living in constant hustle while enduring discrimination, homesickness, and uncertain legal standing a reminder that behind many ofws are stories of struggle, strength, and dreams deferred

a heartfelt exploration of love, sacrifice, and personal growth set against the backdrop of hong kongs bustling cityscape the chemistry between kathryn bernardo and alden richards is undeniable, their performances grounding the emotional core of the film the story of joy, an ofw navigating her dreams and a complicated relationship, is both compelling and heartbreaking its a reflection of the sacrifices many filipinos make for a better future however, while the romance is touching, the pacing feels a bit uneven at times, and some plot points seem predictable the portrayal of the struggles of an ofw could have been explored deeper, as some aspects feel overly simplified for a broader audience nonetheless, the film leaves you with a powerful message that sometimes, you have to let go of love in order to truly find yourself and your own happiness its a bittersweet journey of realizing that love is not always about holding on, but knowing when to let go and move forward a solid effort with a lot of emotional resonance, even if it occasionally falls into predictable tropes

joy, a live in migrant cum domestic helper in hong kong, prepares to leave for canada to pursue her dreams when she unexpectedly meets ethan, and the two fall in love however, their relationship comes at the risk of their personal goals and aspirations while it's probably my third watch, this time with an objective, so here are thoughts i felt some scenes were mixed with the usual pushy theatrics, overly focused shots, and an excessive number of romantic background songs unnecessarily shoved into the film, occasionally straying from authenticity and realism overall, the film manages to maintain authenticity for more than three fourths of its runtime hello, love, goodbye offers something for everyoneheartbreaking romance, politically tinged drama, and uniquely scenic locations in hong kong, encapsulating both the classic three night, four day tourist spots and the lesser known areas it effectively captures the realism of hong kongs live in migrant workers, highlighting their struggles with abuse, poor working conditions, the fight for pr, sunday gatherings of domestic workers, and the depiction of a city that never sleeps bernardo and richards ignite the screen with natural chemistry, speaking volumes through lingering glances and long silences every shared moment crackles with quiet intensity, letting emotions simmer and adding profound depth to their connection, with moments of joyful humor in between the film is lively and, at times, playfully silly, thanks to its ensemble of supporting characters, which helps create a feel good vibe for the audience i personally appreciated the character development approach taken by cathy garcia sampana the first ten minutes serve as a synopsis of joys character, unfolding family issuesfrom the rift between joys mother and father to ethans desire to keep his family together all in all, the films emphasis on character building, assisted by sincere backstories and strong performances from the leads, enhances its authenticity additionally, the films settinghong kongs hazy skyline, busy crowd, and colorful, grid like residential blockspaints a compelling backdrop for a story that leaves audiences hoping for a sequel

my brutally honest review of hello, love, goodbye 2019 directed by cathy garcia sampana score 76 100 potato verdict an interesting character study of domestic helpers in hong kong, and addition to the ofw romance storiespros 1 both kathryn bernardo and alden richards carried the film thankfully, they are both treated as seperate characters and people alden richards never disappoints in fact, hes perfectly casted as someone charming and funny but kayang makipagsabayan sa drama sa family one of his finest performances yet kay no wonder hes one of the best actors of his generation kaya i hope more quality films para mas mapakita yung acting im a fan as a fan ni kath, i can say that this film will go down as one of kathryn bernardos best and memorable performances shes better in roles na may maturity than the usual rom com roles magaling si kath magportray ng strong independent female character kasi mas ramdam mo siya and yung authenticity ng characters niya sa mata pa lang i can really say na kath is one of the greatest actresses ng generation niya sana lang bigyan siya ng mas challenging roles and better scripts commendable for a mainstream film to portrayal of ofws na nagiging tnt din ang lakas ng chemistry ng kathden it doesnt have a forced happy ending because being an ofw means sacrifices buti wala na yung hahabulin sa airport then magiging pabebe then kiss with friends na kinikilig balances romance and comedy nagwork yung star cinema cliche na magkaroon ng maraming friends like kakai and other people kasi justified na meron sense of community yung mga kababayan nating ofw sa hongkong natural for our ofws to survive theres a part where sinabi kay joy na i own half of you ang cute ng character ni mrs shes a natural sobrang heartbreaking ng short encounter ni jerome ponce and kathryn about their lives ang ganda ng execution and comparison ng lives nila hongkong as a brilliant metaphor of alden and kaths love story at the same time like joy, stepping stone ang hongkong for canada ang galing ni joross gamboa maricel laxa had a short but great portrayal great actress sana mas napansin siya ng iba kasi ang galing niya ramdam mo talaga yung struggle ng ofw sa kanya and being an ofw not because may choice pero because it is a need ang ganda ng cinematography and shots ng film kahit nasa hongkong sila, maganda din yung may pa pageant knowing how filipinos are so passionate sa pageantry it also effectively shows yung comedic side ng characters natin very predictable storyline and character problems i like how the actor portrayed the character even if overused na yung puro red flag ang male lead the hows of us, rewind, one more chance, my ex, and whys , pero ang creepy ng pagkakasulat kay ethan sa simula then si kath she deserved more than umiyak and halos lahat na lang gusto niya maayos na problem dati kasi yung nora and vilma ofws, parents ang ofw now naman may maymay and kathryn how did it end up na children are now sacrificing their dreams and even love life umay ako sa ikaw at ako playing sa mga specific moments nagmumukhang music video i wish nagpakita sila na nurse si kath na nagstruggle naghanap ng trabaho sa hongkong when she arrived thats the fantasy na after we graduate may job ka na ang ganda sana may dialogues about brain drain ng nurses natin and grab foreign opportunities dahil sa mababang salary sa ph also joy entering canada doesnt seem like a realistic solution we can all root for in real life, they still experience a much more complex and competitive process pa maxine medina and jameson blake

they engaged ethan's alden richards character into a playboy turned humbled archetype genuinely falling in love with joy kathryn bernardo , despite the latter's constant disregard to his actions when initially pursuing her the film provides a definite picture of the fate of their relationship, though cute and sweet, is quite less interesting, honestly not to mention the soundtrack of the film charot and this is coming from the fact that they also chose to navigate a much essential story the collective plight of overseas filipino workers ofw in hong kong there have been numerous films capturing the stories of overseas workers this film specifies the struggles in the eyes of domestic helpers in hk joy is among those who has made sacrifices in an attempt to experience an economic progress they have to live in a system that limits them as well, yet, for joy, she continues to live beyond the limited lines and risks her life for arrest and deportation at the center, we get to immerse in the crowds of workers 'veteran' workers hyping up 'fresh' workers saying they will get used to it, workers busily arranging packages to send back home, phone calls of longingness and heartbreak, and we even get a glimpse of the tragic situation of joy's mother kathryn bernardo potrayed the character like her rent is due ang daming nangyari sa buhay niya with all the struggles, responsibility, pressures, all that continue to burden her, and she carried it all and nasa punto siguro ako ng buhay ko na naniniwalang parang display lang talaga kung titingnan si ethan no hate but then again, this is direk cathy, and this is a romance drama film

here, i realized that love will not force you to choose because love should be the foundation of a relationship another thing is that we are capable of becoming more than we think we can the story beautifully revolves around the life of an ofw, shedding light on aspects often unseen by manythe need for a safe space and a reason to save up sometimes, life becomes hard to understand, especially when we decide to choose ourselves, only to meet someone who might also choose us like an airplane, it departs with a destination, carrying lessons, and the film portrayed that beautifully

the plot was good but it was not amazing or special or different in any other way maybe they've adapted this deep and hurtful hugot lines because that's what catches viewer's attention when watching trailers and that's what is used for memes on social media alden richards proved to people that he does know how to act he has this charm that can make you swoon but it was not enough for me to feel a spark between him and kathryn bernardo kathryn just keeps getting better and better her acting on this film is way more mature than those of her other films cinematography is good especially during the first part and the climax i love how the pallette switches from vivid strong colors in the drama's hardworking scenes to dark, warm colors for its personal and intimate parts not that crazy about the scoring though filled with long dialogues,and cliches, hello love, goodbye still did not capture the drama of being an ofw in hongkong even though the hard to get scenes and perseverance to woo the woman are there, it remains on the box of a typical romance flick which we have already seen a number of times it sure adapted a different ending from our most typical pinoy movie hits back then but the execution of presenting the reason behind it was not that powerful as well
this filipino movie though, bernardos best performance yet shouldve won the urian back in 2019

hello, love, goodbye comes across as the philippines la la land but grounded in its culture and story a romance drama that shows the bitter reality of people trying to chase their dreams in tough situations actors kathryn bernardo and alden richards are sensational and display immaculate chemistry the realistic story about love dreams, will touch your heart and soul as someone who is half filipino, it was eye opening experience to witness the hardships of my culture hello, love, goodbye is a great romance drama filled with hard truths and reality but with added beauty and pain to create a wonderful film so i saw the sequel to this film hello, love, again currently in theaters first it was my introduction to philippines cinema once i was informed on twitter that theres a first film, i decided to check it out the plot of hello, love, goodbye is pretty clear cut set in hong kong, a filipina domestic helper working hard to make the move to canada meets a filipino bartender trying to help his family even with the truth and circumstances laid out these two are drawn to each other leading to a honest portrayal of love, with all the highs and lows that come attached with it it was refreshing to see a story feature characters who dont have everything together and are also struggling made things feel more genuine and authentic to me especially prominent in the brief little joys, no pun intended and adventures they partake in to escape their reality this film did a good job of hitting you hard in the feels some might not like how it ended but i did if you are a dreamer like myself, it made perfect sense i really have to commend actor kathryn bernardo for giving us such a gripping performance as joy her character goes through so much that she has to endure to maintain focus on her dream luckily kathryn bernardo really gave her best to convey the various emotions of joys situation brilliantly she had the best performance in the movie her co star alden richards matched her incredible acting and energy with his character ethan but we can all relate to ethan because love makes you do strange things however alden richards adds a lot of charm and sincerity to ethan hello, love, goodbye is an excellent romance drama from the philippines even though its ingrained fully into its culture, it can be easily enjoyed by everyone for we all have been in similar situations when it comes to relationships, dreams and love ive always maintained that the best romance films arent the ones that give you the typical happy ending this is what makes hello, love, goodbye beautiful as always, go watch this for yourself

joy makes the difficult decision to leave hong kong for canada to pursue her dream of becoming a nurse, which puts her and ethan in a long distance relationship as they each live in their respective cities, time and the covid 19 pandemic take their toll on their relationship after going their separate ways, fate has again brought them together under different circumstances and as evolved individuals this is an excellent romantic movie with a good balance of comedy and drama the story is simple, but the combination of immigration, a global pandemic, and a pinch of cultural humor makes it unique the story shares how love grows and changes and how individuals must grow and change to survive and thrive this is a great movie to stream for a unique international romance

timeless classic, a beloved filipino movie that made its mark on cinema history back in 2019, there was so much chaos in the philippines, station wars, loveteams flopping, and everything in between kathryn bernardo and alden richards had one shot to save it and they freaking did two of the most influential filipino celebrities teamed up and broke our hearts major kudos to them rewatching this movie now, especially with the sequel on air, i have to say its been the most heartfelt pinoy film of the decade its so real and authentic, showing how filipinos have to live overseas just to earn enough for their families joy gave up her dreams for others, its so unfair but so true to life, but this guy ethan had some problem with attachment issues lmao, it's such a perfect way to end it without them being together alden richards, the man you are can we talk about his acting ive never seen him act like that before because gma keeps giving him mid movies not to be shady, but fr no wonder it became a blockbuster hit joy is here this first movie is pure nostalgia cinematic, leveled up, and with a soundtrack that was soundtracking this just made me want to watch hello, love, again even more now that joy is happier in canada

if you love me, why cant you choose if you love me, why are you making me choose but i always had a soft spot for them, especially due to how skilled filipinos are when it comes to implementing the perfect amount of drama and sentiment into their entertainment this movie was pretty solid to me when considering how i was never into these type of movies ive watched a good amount of filo romance movies and like i said, i was never a big fan which is why i was surprised when i found myself appreciating this movie for different aspects and executions first of all, reminds me a lot of la la land 2016 except filipino ofw version as much as it hurts, i like to treasure those bittersweet or tragic love stories because its realistic i live for the realism the hope and joy whilst feeling that agony and yearning, bc i think it really shows u how things really are for a lot of relationships and couples the reality how it was never just about love and trust, but understanding understanding your significant other, and how even when you guys do, the ending isnt always going to be happy i think its a common plot and ive def seen it before i just enjoyed this execution and i liked the mature take on it this movie felt like an entire leap of maturity for both the characters esp ethan and shows the growth of their relationship and of them as people i also loved their chemistry, alden richards and kathryn bernardo as the main couple i was honestly surprised bc i grew up watching some of kaths films and thought she never had a romance one without that daniel padilla dude and i am not mad that i was wrong bc i rlly liked alden and kathryn together they delivered the emotional scenes incredibly and i js loved watching them i also appreciate another bare minimum feature that kinda ties into what i was just talking about but multi dimension like i said, ive seen the plot been done and its nothing groundbreaking or revolutionary but this movie specifically also had me looking at both sides, both dimensions, and understanding both i saw how there wasnt a bad guy nor a good guy, how both were multi dimensional and had their reasons i just loved how it was very clear and how raw certain scenes were im giving it only 3 n a half stars tho bc i js still found myself cringing like hell everytime alden richards character was being creepy af and idk theres js this vibe ab filo movies i cant get over lovebeingpinoy tho

what do you get when you mix love, uncompromisable responsibilities, and uncontrollable circumstances this movie the title sums it up really well it presented a realistic view on how love can move mountains, but not one's dreams and aspirations although many romantic films opt to go for happy endings, i'm glad this one didn't ethan and joy's motivations were so grounded and solid that it would be disloyal to their characters if they went another way i like how the film also subverts classic romantic movie tropes by beginning with the first kiss and uttering the i don't love you s it all made sense in the end and it felt earned let's see what the sequel has in store
really makes you open your eyes about the hardships that ofw have to endure, and the ending was really bittersweet, looking forward to watching the sequel

hello, love, goodbye pulls us into the bustling streets of hong kong, where we follow joy, an ofw working as a domestic helper through her story, the film powerfully captures the resilience, sacrifice, and quiet heartbreak of filipinos abroad kathryn bernardos performance is raw and compelling, embodying joys exhaustion, determination, and longing she dreams of migrating to canada to create a better life alden richards brings surprising depth as ethan, joys love interest his characters introspective warmth and grounded approach complement bernardos emotional intensity, offering moments of hope and connection amidst the harsh reality they face while ethans backstory couldve been explored more, richards growth as an actor shines, lending a layered dynamic to their relationship the supporting cast enriches the films emotional impact, with maymay entrata, kakai bautista, joross gamboa, jeffrey tan, and lovely abella adding warmth, humor, and camaraderie cathy garcia molina delivers her best work yet, handling complex themes with sensitivity rewatching it, the films painful message resonates even more love alone, often, cannot make us whole this is a moving, memorable story of love and sacrifice

at first, i wasnt sure if kathryn and alden would have good chemistry together, but i was wrong its a typical filipino romantic comedy drama film, with a great cast and some cheesy but unforgettable lines they look really good together, even better than kathryn's last on screen partner the story is pretty much relatable, especially if youre an ofw, because cathy wrote it really well she really pushed kathryn and alden into a whole new level, too the only part that didnt feel right to me was aldens character, ethan it seemed strange and creepythat joy would let ethan stalk her around in the beginning of the film, and he does seem a bit creepy at first i dont think id react like joy did but, overall, its an entertaining movie to watch i enjoyed it and cant wait to see the sequel this weekend

i just watched this to prepare for seeing the sequel with my cousin and i was not expecting much when i started it but already from the beginning, it sets up the story beautifully it captures life accurately as an ofw with kathryns character joy balancing the hustle and struggle of living there when she meets ethan, its charming but not overbearing the build up of their relationship was so natural i love the scene choices that were made for the montage type of scenes then when they do finally get together it feels like a big sigh of relief even when it comes to the time that joy chooses to take the chance to move in vancouver, their conversation was honest no unnecessary yelling involved then coming to the conclusion of letting her go for her dreams while still loving each other its a beautiful message to end on i also loved all the supporting characters they had a reason and backstory as to what their motives are the cinematography and story pacing was so good too excited to see the sequel tomorrow

with the upcoming release of its sequel, hello, love, again 2024 , i figured id go ahead and give this film a rewatch in preparation for the new one i remember not really expecting much from this film, and i was honestly quite surprised by it it is a fairly solid film thats well directed by cathy garcia sampana it feels a lot more mature than some romance drama filipino films, especially in how it tackles some of its themes its also carried by its two main leads, kathryn bernardo and alden richards, who have great chemistry with one another that said, the story is rather formulaic, and the characters are a little generic but as a whole, this film right here was still a pretty decent watch

i usually prefer watching western movies rather than filipino movies because i sometimes think that the plot of filipino movies, specifically the latest ones, are too cliche but this film definitely made me change my mind its a great film kathryn is an amazing actress and alden wasnt so bad as well this film really depicts the sad reality that several filipinos must go through due to financial instability the director of this film did an amazing job capturing the real life struggles of our ofws aside from that, kathryns character joy definitely breaks the typical female protagonist stereotypes in romance films where the girl gives up everything just to be with the love of her life in this film, joy taught us that sometimes its okay to be selfish for once especially when youve been nothing but selfless all your life in life, we have to make decisions no matter how painful it gets some decisions are necessary in order for us to have a brighter future to look forward to i admire her character because it shows how much of a strong willed person she is despite ethans attempt to make joy stay, she knew that this wasnt the life that she wanted and that she could do so much more leaving wasnt easy for her but she knew that she had to in order to achieve her dreams overall, this film is so worth watching you know the film is good when kathryn bernardo is starring in it p

i think this movie wanted to be a lot of things it wanted to be an ofw story, a love story, and a filipino story the ending was a story trying to find a grip most of the time ofw stories have the same formula, one person jaded by reality, and another who yearns for something more it works wonders if done well, and the authenticity of this one really makes for an engaging world i left the movie knowing that i understood the filipino subculture that occurs overseas compared to movies like milan and barcelona i would love to see a version of this movie where joy doesn't have to leave because she's grown attached to the child and the grandmother and working hard for them is making up for the love she missed out on but it is an ofw story, and the family she serves will have to have some hostile moment to make us feel sympathetic to her cause will give it props that it didn't take the safe ending where ethan and joy meet somewhere and they'll both have it all their decisions have consequences, and i like that they accepted it in the end

my mom says we've seen this film before but i genuinely don't remember so naturally i watched this on my flight out of the philippines kathryn bernardo is such a wonderful actress, that woman can do anything just about any role and be successful in it she's so good in this that you can't help but feel for her character and the things she has to go through alden is also very charming and the little actions he does like how he moves closer to kathryn during the kitchen scene after he spent a night with his ex and she won't talk to him because she's jealous pero, and not to use therapy speak , ethan needs to go to therapy or do some self reflection before getting into another relationship as he clearly has attachment issues he was very clingy and tried to do everything he could to provide for her and, in turn, convince her to stay in hong kong to be with him despite her saying the entire time they were together that she wanted to go to canada and make use of her degree and do something with her life other than be a domestic helper there was even that moment when everything was falling apart for joy with her finding out that her mother doesn't intend on leaving her husband and her father not wanting to go to canada and ethan's response was essentially, maybe this is the universe telling you that you don't have to leave hong kong and you can just stay here with me like with that being said, though, the way ethan loves that's all

star cinema cathy garcia molina is always a good watch you can always expext a well produced, well written film that will captivate you from the start up to the end one of the things i appreciate the most in this movie is how the supporting characters, specifically their friend groups, brought life and entertainment to the movie while watching, i can't help but think how challenging to produce a filipino movie abroad i always notice the crowd looking or recoginizing the actors in the background it also ironic how a film shot abroad will make you feel that it is really a small world after all, the characters are always on the same places, casually bumping into each other too much while budget costraints are completely understandable, there is definitely a room for improvement overall, this movie did not fall short on giving you a classic romantic filipino movie experience, giving you the right amount of kilig while also touching into social and family issues

i rewatched this recently pero nakalimutan ko lang i logfilm wise and considering it overall, masasabi kong mahusay ang pagkakabuo ni direk cathy, dumudulas siya sa gitna ng 3 5 to a flat 4 stars out of 5 starssiguro ang mali sa film na ito is more than the film itself but rather ang ating pag iisip napaka weirdong lalaki ni ethan sa totoong buhay kung tutuusin magaling mangmanipula at may paniniwalang siya ang may kakayahang gumawa ng tamang desisyon una ko 'tong pinanood grade 9 ako, katorse anyos kami no'n ng mga kaklase ko and majority ng peers namin at the time e kilig na kilig sa mga moments ni joy at ethan nung bago maging sila, kahit naman kami, lalo na yung scene nila ro'n sa backroompero now, in the eyes of someone who has learned and unlearned substantial matters sa ating lipunan at lalo na patungkol sa gender at ang existing system of capitalism and patriarchy e sa totoo lang napaka uncomfortable panoorin ang character ni ethanfrom the character pipeline on him i mentioned above, nag progress siya to this man na gustong ikulong si joy sa bisig niya dahil kaya niya namang mag provide at mabigyan ng magandang buhay si joyif joy wasn't persistent about leaving, she would have been robbed of her identity as a woman, and she would be following the path of a million filipinas, a victim to the hands of a man dahilan sa kakulangan mga kalidad na oportunidad na inilalaan ng ating lipunan sa mga babae nakakatuwa na hindi ito ginawang typical love story ni direk cathy with the motto na love concurs all type shittotoo, may pagka predictable ang flow ng plot pero it doesn't erase the beauty of it anyway hahaha nagamit ko rin 'to as a reference to one of our discussions sa major subject ko sa kolehiyo dahil maganda ang pagtatalakay nito sa buhay ng ating mga ofw na domestic helper, ang pagkakaisa ng mga pilipino, kung saan e nagagawa nating tahanan ang bawat sulok ng mundo, ahahahah marami pang iba nakalimutan ko na lang xd nasa lec notes ko 'yon hahaha palompalo ako kasi discussion namin and a good reference will hook the students to understand the topic discussed much easily tapos mas mapapalalim mo pa and their interest lingers and boogsh a successful teaching style

my mum turned on the tv and i fully expected her to put on a stereotypical cheesy filipino romcom where the man and the women have absolutely no flaws whatsover, the gay best friend 2 sassy women pushing her to step out of her comfort zone ending with the woman giving up on her hopes and dreams to be with the guy i was pulled in from the beginning this movie really resonated with me having grown up with a filipino immigrant mum and her community of ofw domestic helper friends in singapore in spite of all the pressure they faced to provide for their families at home, the abuse they may have faced from their employers, they were always so cheerful and somehow had the money to buy me gifts every once in a while the love and the culture i experienced growing up have shaped me into the person i am today and i will always be grateful girl, youre better than him thats whats stopping me from giving this movie a higher score tbh slightly forgivable given the other things i highly praised about but i loved the movies exploration of women and their responsibilites towards their family all over the world, women are the ones who leave their families, giving up on their dreams to work in an ass job in hopes of a better life many women work full time and are yet expected to hold down the fort at home and my heart breaks for these women, including my mum, who gave up on her dream of being a nurse in canada to be in singapore as a retail worker because she met a guy whom she would marry and have me mum, i know it is not my fault, but im sorry that you could not make it to canada one day i'll take you there, i promise

as part of our lunchtime movie binges, hello, love, goodbye is a that romantic drama that explores the complexities of love, ambition, and sacrifice among overseas filipino workers ofws in hong kong the film's realistic portrayal of the struggles and dreams of ofws resonates deeply, while the chemistry between the lead actors, kathryn bernardo and alden richards, is undeniable the heartfelt performances and emotional depth of the characters elevate the film beyond typical romance tropes, leaving a lasting impact on viewers

with the announcement of hello, love, again, its was time yet again for me to visit this romcom gold mine and for this second viewing, i have seemed to appreciate it a half star more the operatic, dramatized monologues and back and forths between joy and ethan have grown in me i felt their words better than last time, somehow, and though i understand that these types of writing were manufactured to emit such reactions from the audience, i cannot deny the goosebumps y tingling sensation i felt during such dramatic scenes the performances i still find amazing, the dramatic scenes punched hard, the romantic scenes were cheesy but sweet, and the funny side characters were wholesome ly funny i did say last time that this was problematic, which if looking at it at one side, it is, but i think it was necessary to further enhance the stakes and to give the characters more reason to go or not to go ahead with their decisions this problematic element is not in any harmful way being glorified, thus its usage increases the dramatic structure of the story and gives justification to the dramatic choices, thus giving layer to the characters and their inner selves ive also come to appreciate some tiny details the montage like cutting was very effective in building the world and the budding relationship maricel laxa played her short appearances amazingly the final exchange between the leads was greatly implied like their wedding vows and surprisingly, i didnt hate the endless kung di rin lang ikaw in the background reading the logline for the sequel, i really hope they dont fumble it, they have something special here

i had to rewatch this kasi may sequel na raw and gaaadd, this is a love letter for our kababayans sa ibang bansa mahusay palagi ng linyahan ng star cinema hindi ko siya totally magets as 18 year old self pero ngayon na nasa adulting phase na ko, mas nakuha ko na ang sacrifices ni joy i will not hold you back hits different now after ng breakup so excited for kath alden's comeback

you know what its actually pretty good for the most part i still wouldve preferred a slightly different ending that still retains joy getting to follow her dreams of moving to canada, but color me surprised even with the positive reactions, i didnt hate this im so sorry , its a great decision to actually have him learn rather than have men like him win in the story even if they are actually wrong script wise, for one, i am aware that this is a romance film but i ended up being more interested in the ofw subplot i have merely seen the trailer of sunday beauty queen but parts of this instantly reminded me of that film some may say that the film already needed more time dedicated to the romance plot but i wish it was a little more consequential to tie itself to its ofw subplot there are some good shots with impressive lighting here and there, yet they are never consistent as there are also shots that are too overexposed and poorly lit for my liking i am aware that the motifs in the score would always be based off of a mainstream song, but having heard kung 'di rin lang ikaw even months before this film's initial release high school tingz , i find it to be a little overplayed at some points oh, and louder music doesn't always mean more emotional impact still, i guess the film's biggest redeeming point is its direction yes, it's a mainstream romance film, but it offers different flavor through its more mature approach spotty dialogue aside, the more emotional scenes work well on their own and never feel forced, even if they are a little too on the nose i did not feel the chemistry of kathryn bernardo and alden richards at first, but damn it, kathryn can carry hard she just knows how to ground her character so well without making it feel superficial some people are probably tired of the comedic 'sidekick' best friend s of the lead female character but i personally found kakai bautista to be hilarious not all of her jokes land, but when they do, it's absolutely funny the vilma santos scene probably got the loudest laugh out of me and holy fuck, i knew that was jameson blake playing peter everything said here may have come across as if the negatives outweight the positives but hello, love, goodbye is thankfully saved by garcia sampana's no longer garcia molina honest direction and bernardo's strong acting perhaps its approach to showing the ofw life in hong kong can be shallow, but it's a good first step to bringing that story tied with its main romance plot into a mainstream filipino film by utilizing the appeal of the two leads from their own different loveteams to tell a new romance story, it gets its point across effectively once the credits have rolled, i was relieved that i did not hate it, even if it's not quite my thing i havent heard ikaw at ako in so long high school has officially been very long ago for me and i had no idea it would play here, nor have i known that i would hear j 0n m rv fuck ethan lol thank god joy questioned her place in his plans bc even i was thinking about the fact that he only ever thought about himselfedit nawt them announcing a sequel as soon as i posted this review lmaoooooo
