watched hello, love, goodbye at sm north edsa cinema 6 its first hour last 15 minutes tells an interesting, heartening, compelling and high spirited ofw story fueled with great acting from kathryn bernardo the first hour of hello love goodbye sets up an interesting heartening plot main character kathryn bernardo portrays an empowering existential libertarian take of a pinay ofw torn between her joy dreams obligation hello love goodbye reminds me of kita kitahello love goodbye could've followed the cinematic style and storytelling structure of kita kita to be a great film kathryn bernardoalden richards is comparable with alessandra de rossi empoy marquez kathden alempoyif only direk sigrid bernardo be the director instead of cathy garcia molinahello love goodbye could've been a great, well made and well treated film the film lays out an interesting and compelling plot as well as a kathryn bernardo main character as joy that we would all sympathize and root for the concept of spiritually living in transit in a strange foreign land working hard to make a desired reality happen one day is the film's conceit that really hits hard to all of us in this modern, demanding and even depriving world we are living in, we are all racing against time to reach our desired goals in life or else we would never achieve it this is pretty smart stuff for a filipino ofw story we always watch filipino films about ofws where the ofw main character always sacrifices his her life and personal well being to fulfill his her responsibilities to the family he she left behind in the philippines this is a long worn out story and we had enough of it hello love goodbye turns the table around instead of highlighting the selfless sacrifice of a typical filipino ofw, the film smartly tackles an examination of a lonely ofw's existence in a foreign land balancing what he she really likes against what he she is supposed to do i believe hello love goodbye opens this paradigm which really hooks my attention and root for the story kita kita almost touches this ingenious examination of ofw but never gets there as direk sigrid bernardo never intends to portray such theme direk cathy garcia molina since my perfect you , the hows of us and three words to forever is exploring and digging further her creative mind in coming up with ingeniously joyous filipino stories while keeping that worn out and obsolete star cinema filipino family rom com formula hello, love, goodbye is kathryn bernardo at her best so far good thing she escapes and breaks off from the tight bound clutches of her constant leading man, daniel padilla therefore, kathryn bernardo is truly free as an actress and as a woman without daniel padilla at her side, kathryn bernardo did not fall down but instead rose higher than what she used to be just as an eye candy amateur teeny bop damsel of a brute teenage heartthrob debonair kathryn bernardo as joy in hello love goodbye successfully and convincingly emulates the existential crisis a filipino ofw has to face as she braves working in transit in a strange foreign land while examining her choices and personal well being in life there is a strong libertarian take on hello love goodbye that makes me like the film at first and kathryn bernardo's great acting make that happen loud and bright on the big sm cinema big screen again, this is smart stuff and kathryn bernardo as joy would be one of the most striking filipino movie characters that i have watched at least on the film's strong first hour alden richards plays ethan who is more of a sassy comic relief yet effective mpdg for kathryn bernardo as joy his character as ethan started out as a male creep stalking kathryn bernardo as joy in a misogynist distasteful manner that even senator risa hontiveros would never approve of i guess direk cathy garcia molina is trying to make a daniel padilla out of alden richards with daniel padilla always bullying or tormenting kathryn bernardo for her to love him direk cathy may safe spaces law na tayo thanks to senator risa hontiveros but i really do not mind alden richards portraying as a sex crazy playboy luring kathryn bernardo into a one night stand i believe his flawed character gives merit to the powerful first hour and what hello love goodbye is supposed to be but i do wonder if direk cathy garcia molina inject that sex maniac character flaw for the male mpdg to justify that one night stand motel scene seems direk cathy and the filipino masses are really after kathryn bernardo shoving her face to alden richard's bare muscular chest i actually like the unusual pairing of the troubled serious kathryn bernardo with the carefree hypersexual alden richards this unusual pairing reminds me of alexandra de rossi and empoy marquez of kita kita the kathden dynamic in hello love goodbye could have been a more improved, more substantial version of alempoy in kita kita kathryn bernardo and alden richards interacting in hello love goodbye is similar to those sassy asian chinese, japanese, korean teenage romcoms that i get to watch on hbo red channel only, the kathden may be something more meaningful than a unusual campy romantic sexual pairing the first half of hello love goodbye really sets us up for a promising story that i am eager to watch hello love goodbye starts well the film establishes an interesting, heartfelt ofw story, introduces a charismatic, relatable and empowering female kathryn bernardo lead character and builds up an uncanny yet endearing relationship between kathryn bernardo and alden richards depriving and robbing us of a great story to unravel from an inspiring, heartfelt and empowering ofw story on the first hour hello, love, goodbye suddenly drops everything and shifts into a cheesy standard bloated star cinema romcom love story with lots of these shit 1 instant falling in love that does not feel earned and 4 speedy resolutions that does not make a big impact to the hearts and minds of the audience so cathy garcia molina still adopts her standard star cinema family romcom formula into the promising hello love goodbye story even when the film does not really need it we are deprived of watching a great story until the end in hello, love, goodbye the typical star cinema family romcom formula that direk cathy garcia molina is fond to insert is not bad always this overused family formula does work well for some of the following cathy molina's films 1 you changed my life starring sarah geronimo and john lloyd cruz2 my perfect you starring gerald anderson and pia wurtzbach and 3 the hows of us starring kathryn bernardo and daniel padilla this star cinema romcom formula which thrills the filipino masses, unfortunately causes a big void at the 2nd half of the real promising story of hello love goodbye including hello, love, goodbye as its latest casualty the audience never gets to watch the real, more heartfelt ofw story of kathryn bernardo as joy and her libertarian existential adventures with alden richards as ethan just like any other typical star cinema filmshello love goodbye is so bloated although she has a charming potential to have an pinay hk ofw movie of her own alden richards as ethan's personal existential struggle may not be necessary but should not be emphasized as much as the struggles of kathryn bernardo as joy alden and kathryn's friends should never overstay their welcome to the real story maxine medina is a beautiful yet useless distraction to the movie the real story does not even require for ethan and joy to madly fall in love and become sassy sweethearts finally, the interesting sub story of maricel laxa as joy's mother who is forced to marry a foreigner to secure a resident's visa is so not explored further i assume that cathy garcia molina intend to portray the over glamorized 2nd hour to be ethan and joy's existence in the now but hello, love, goodbye redeemed itself on the last 15 minutes of the film it is actually the real resolution to the existential ofw crisis that both kathryn bernardo and alden richards are facing hello, love, goodbye could have worked if its 2nd hour is a more serious, more composed, yet truly heartfelt intelligently memorable adventures solely between kathryn bernardo as joy and alden richards as ethan both would continue to explore their libertarian existence together either as lovers or bffs as they continue to work their asses off in hong kong, they continue to examine their existence, wants, needs, priorities and obligations and that is where their prospect about love in the world of constant demands and uncertainties take place all other supporting characters interact at their minimum as the real hello love goodbye story is soley focused on alden and kathryn this is how the movie should be if it were serious enough to be a great movie i guess hello love goodbye could've worked if it follows the story and cinematic style of kita kita i do wish cathy garcia molina consulted with sigrid bernardo on how to make hello, love, goodbye work rather than making a great movie which is a worthy follow up to the great quezon's game movie 9 10 as hello, love, goodbye is an exhibition of kathryn bernardo at her bestalden richards at first plays a convincing effective uncanny free spirited character worthy of a companion for kathryn bernardo with this, alden richards still performs his best in his previous film, imagine you and me as direk mike tuveria really puts alden's talent to good use to make the aldub film work somehow but its strength is its middle part which kathryn bernardo and daniel padilla exhibits that magical romantic feeling artfully around an old house that is really glamorously teasing our emotions but it didn't damage the story for its mid scene is awesome the first half and the last 15 minutes of the film are gold in the story

you can look past through the sappy by it being filled with palpable ofw stories and heartfelt moments of almost every character that scene when joy sees her nursing classmate having his honeymoon in hk, then is asked what is she doing there, what a tearjerker it has many subplots about family, self worth, career, and brief encounters that can stand alone, but their sum is a surprising and refreshing experience so much better when rewatched

it's the specificity that i enjoyed the most there have been many movies about the ofw experience, but this one roots itself in the particulars of the hong kong domestic helper they're women who have made the great sacrifice to be separated from their families for the sake of potential economic prosperity they are given work, certainly, but they aren't free to seek other work joy is pursuing a dream, seeking a life beyond being the absent breadwinner for a family that doesn't feel her suffering and because she wants more, she can't just stay within the very limited lines of her existence, risking arrest and deportation just to scrape together enough money to find a means to a better existence in the margins, we see the internalized tragedy of a people convinced that this is somehow an acceptable situation veteran domestic helpers constantly telling a neophyte that she'll get used to this life, a phone call back home that's about having to extend a contract another two years and at the center, we learn about joy's mother, whose tragic situation exemplifies the commodification of the filipino woman, and the trauma that it brings the relationship stuff is less specific ethan fits into the playboy made good archetype a lothario who develops real feelings for a girl because she initially rejects him, and then seems to tirelessly pursue her despite her consistent pleas for him to stop it's cute and stuff, but it feels like a distraction from the genuinely incisive examination of the hong kong ofw situation but none of that erases all the good that the film does even as the romance takes the fore, the movie is smart enough to make it all feel burdened by the tragedies inherent to a people who have resigned themselves to the reality of a home that can no longer be their home also, kathryn bernardo is great in this joy is a fully formed character an industrious young woman who has deferred her dreams under the pretense of a necessary selflessness, struggling under the weight of responsibility all while learning sad truths that will come to shatter her conception of the life she's been pursuing there's a lot going on there, and bernardo just takes it all in and makes it work good stuff
my favorite part of the movie was when maymay entrata did an interpretative dance and ended her routine with a kamehameha

i chickened out of a midnight screening of midsommar and caught this one instead but i was surprised because this one wasnt a walk in the park tooit dropped some heavy emotional bombs with grace though i liked it as a whole hell yeah but it was good because it was honest honest is beautiful well acted, too i cried lots and they portrayed the ofw life honorably and respectfully, i think never underestimate an ofws plight as an immigrants kid, i deeply appreciated how this film didnt shy away from the messy parts of life away from ones home countrythe ugly parts of choosing to be displaced for some years in hopes of saving enough to build a better life for others who might not even deserve it i liked the subtle commentaries no hints of self righteousness and you cant help but root for them because of that i love films that do this remind you of the cheesiness and beauty of being human of falling in love, of owning pain, of being honest about hurting, of independence and codependency, of giving and dreaming

hello, love, goodbye starts with joy played by kathryn bernardo saying something like, in hongkong we don t waste time because every second counts and every second we are payed the film works best when it follows this premise when joy acts as the kayod lang ng kayod breadwinner of the family and when she desperately searches for ways to support her dream of flying to canada to seek a job and follow her passion a different cathy garcia molina filmthis film is envisioned to be like one of the remarkable classic ofw films in the past like dubai , and milan fortunately, the film doesn t settle for that vision alone it raises the story, nuanced to experiences by domestic helpers based in hong kong, where it is illegal to take another job aside from being a dh it also digs deeper, creating a more compelling and informative story about the overseas filipino workers in hong kong to this end, the film may be given credit for its thorough research the middle stumblesit could have been great if the film lived up to that premise and made that nuanced hong kong experience as it s core, but instead it uses the romantic narrative as a way to effectively communicate with its audience just when ethan comes into the picture, familiar filipino movie production processes and cliches come into play the slight resurrectionthankfully, all the second part craze undos itself in the film s last few minutes here, the struggles of both joy and ethan are discussed and are powerfully put together to give the film a compelling touch, grounded to the themes presented in the film s opening the last few minutes of the film however still feels like a long music video only this time, it s disguised as a travelogue although, it is in this long sequence where the most delightful shots are shown, it kind of feels just like a long compilation of tourist vlogs rather than an essential part of the story another resurrection comes at the film s last minute it brilliantly presents the resolution, bringing it to a powerful last shot reminiscent to that of alfonso cuaron s roma , but more explicitly told the best of kathryni never thought i would say this, but this is definitely kathryn s film though this is her most daring and demanding role yet, she perfectly portrays joy s desperation, desire, and inherent sadness this performance is her all time best and i can, with no doubt say that it is something that should seriously be considered by the country s award giving bodies alden richard s ethan however feels like a character that was written for kathryn s on screen partner, daniel padilla despite this, alden richards still plays the role with heart unlike kathryn s role, ethan is not a dramatically demanding character inconsistently goodsometimes, hello, love, goodbye struggles to cope up with it s promising premise at one point it proudly flaunts it s technical excellence, and the next thing you see, a drone is randomly used to show a scene where the main characters are running on a rooftop this film has a lot of potential, in all honesty despite this, it still should be regarded as a cinematic achievement as it presents a raw aspect of the difficult life abroad despite being a studio made film

cathy garcia molina has revitalized her storytelling voice a good mix of crowd pleasing moments and hard to swallow truths the film didnt pull any punches it left me gushing and gut wrenched at the same time

hello, love, goodbye is a film i didn't expect to like i went to the cinema with a passive indifference to pass the time, yet i was utterly blown away once the opening montage scene started it reminded me of the claustrophobic isolation and weariness of chungking express, which also took place in hong kong i thought to myself that it wasn't a bad start at all and it piqued my interest, hoping it manages to be consistently good throughout and it did the portrayal of domestic helpers is realistic it doesn't go all the way to make it a tragic story, to the point of being depressing, as it manages to be hopeful at times with frequent lighthearted moments i have a soft spot for stories about ofw struggles being a child of an ofw, i've witnessed various injustices prevalent in the ofw community the movie brings to light several of them, and they hit home surprisingly, i didn't find the romance corny at all kathryn bernardo and alden richards both come from different well established love teams, and i was initially skeptical that a chemistry between them wouldn't work however, they manage to exceed expectations as they bring the best out of each other kathryn portrayed the role of joy convincingly as a struggling domestic helper trying to make ends meet and realize her dreams alden portrayed the role of ethan as your typical playboy, but he manages to bring out enough nuance to an honestly flawed character escaping the ghosts of his past the cinematography is decent, providing enough satisfactory camera angles to capture the scenic hong kong backdrop the script is pretty standard for a cathy garcia molina film but sufficiently witty, sappy, and genuine all at once the score is average but serviceable certain scenes could've had more emotional impact and tension without the dramatic music despite that, it's not distracting when you have two lead characters pouring their heart out in their respective roles to conclude, hello, love, goodbye isn't just a typical straightforward romance film for me it had enough going on in its story to be engaging while being paced well enough the chemistry is there, and i must admit that the movie touched me in a way that other of its contemporaries haven't ultimately what resonated with me most in this particular film is how it addresses love in the most honest and vulnerable way possible every subplot is instrumental and significant to the film's conclusion, making a brutal yet optimistic statement that i rarely see in romance stories in general

very simple and straighforward it put a spotlight on the hardships of pinoy ofws its sometimes heartbreaking but youll find beauty in those moments, too props to alden for pulling this one off im so happy to see him in these kinds of projects gone are the super pilit love team stories i would want him to work with mikhail red next and of course, kathryn this film is hers

sobrang refreshing ah totoo lahat ng kilig na naramdaman, lahat ng luha na iniluha, at lahat ng sakit na nadama 5 star tuloy

my expectations for this were high because of the praise it has been getting, and it does not disappoint beyond the romance blossoming between the two leads, this shows the hardships and difficulties of life while living as an ofw oversees filipino worker the limited choices and the sacrifices the characters have to endure kathryn bernardo gives a stellar performance as joy and this is possibly her best performance to date she is clearly supported by her male co star who reciprocates her performance though bernardo is the center of the story usually its the woman who ends up self sacrificing for love, or the issues of the man are not addressed while giving the couple their happy ending this played out perfectly it was sensible and realistic there was no gimmick, and the direction their relationship headed addressed the situation the leads were in this is one for the books also kudos to the cinematographer and the writer

kathryn's performance here was quintessential kathryn, kathryn on the hows of us was really the best i have seen from her the way the film presented his character and how we got to know him better was very effective may i just note that joross gamboa's performance here was so hilarious like, as in sobrang benta ng jokes na kahit ano nalang din siguro lumabas sa bibig niya ay nakakatawa rito story wise, what i really did like was it didn't romanticize the hardships of our ofws, it presented the harsh reality of working outside the country kathryn really captured it the film wasn't really the dark, heavy drama ish film but it made me reflect on the privileges that i have and shouldn't take for granted last note, sana mapalitan 'yung chroma part sa last scene choz
this movie will prove that the tangent line kind of relationship fate exists you might be meeting exactly once but you can still make great moments from it so so so film

a young filipino woman working in hong kong meets a young bartender she's about to complete her contract and go to greener pastures in canada and it's by cathy garcia molina, so seeing her name normally makes me go to the opposite direction, having seen a few of her past films but this one, to her credit, has a bit more substance there's a compelling drama here about the plight of overseas filipino workers ofw's but blended with the formulaic romantic dramedy that is her bread and butter they do the usual hugot emotional romantic scene in the end where they telegraph every emotion through overly written emotional speeches each trying to out romance each other but it's still a solid drama before that

a breath of fresh air it's funny and sweet and heartbreaking without trying so hard i especially love the fact that it doesn't revolve around ethan and joy, but mostly around ofws their life outside kath is amazing as always 1 and you can really feel her every emotion in each scene i love how she knows where she's going and how she's gonna get it also i loved the tour around hk the shots where ethan and joy weren't the focus and they were just in the corner, giving the spotlight to hk's sights thank u team dog eyes
i will always believe i'm the love child of ethan and joy

if there's one thing the movie can really boast about, it's the strength of the acting between its two leads kathryn bernardo acted her heart out in this you can literally feel the sweat, desperation and exhaustion her character endures in her stint as a domestic helper in hong kong at this point, she proved that she can carry a movie all by herself alden richards also proved here that he came a long way from his pabebe aldub days his acting definitely improved and was pretty solid overall although i did have a problem with how the relationship started in the first half alden really was a straight up stalker, wasn't he , the movie redeemed itself after, not just with how the relationship was ultimately executed, but the execution of the film's central message of how loving yourself over everything else is not necessarily a selfish thing there's definite chemistry between the two of them, and given how successful the movie is critically and financially speaking, i'm looking forward to their next movie together another thing that i really like is that without getting into spoilers the movie could had easily ended in a traditional happy ending but they chose not to, instead delving more into an ending that is whilst bittersweet, much more grounded and admirable it made the movie had so much more of an impact at the end and i already really dug the last ten minutes so that was something hopefully star cinema does keep up this surge of quality and care in its films i mean, it's not a stunning innovation per se, but it's a noticeable improvement in quality coughs vice ganda coughs if there's one thing to be learned from this movie, it's that filipino audiences do are starting to care on the quality of their local mainstream films, and less on cheap laughs and hollow kilig moments

its both nice and scary how this movie was so grounded in its portrayal of how class struggle seeps in and plays out into peoples lives an all around great cast loved the supporting kathryn fucking killed it with one, and so did alden, if not without his cheesy one liners but oh well you gotta deal with what youre handed with

hello, love, goodbye review cgm's farewell note to cinema is a sincere procedural on the measures of familial, eros and self love chungking express and before sunrise, anyone i kid this time, blockbuster director cgm challenged herself, or at least that's what i felt and saw apart from the word play and tongue in cheek banters we've all grown accustomed to most of her films, this one hits different from the trailing shots, the hallucinogenic montages and moody shots ala wkw, this really is quite the departure from the usual cathy garcia molina and i commend her for that, and obviously giving due props to her presumably auteur aspirations, wkw and linklater, hello, love, goodbye served us feel good familiarity and a bit of philosophy on the power of choice and chance

the two main actors for this film are big stars and are part of the two most popular tandems in the philippines with different partners, though so i thought this was going to be another teeny bopper lovey dovey movie but i still gave it a go since this newly formed loveteam intrigued me i normally am not a big fan of romances but i was so pleasantly surprised by this movie the marketing was mostly focusing on the love story because filipinos usually...

by far, the best cathy garcia molina movie in my opinion surprisingly, kathryn and alden definitely have a chemistry, even if they were in different tv stations cgm really squeezed these two leads to their boundaries to deliver an outstanding movie that is well loved by the fans, the non fans and the critics it's not that over the top drama but the supporting actors really did all of that it's a signature cgm move the supportive, loud, hilarious friends can be quite an eye and ear sore the realism of the story is the selling point of this one aside from the lead actors and it's perfectly portrayed and captured you can feel the hardships, the pain, with or without experiencing it, it will hit you very hard a sequel may or may not be needed but i'm very satisfied on how it ended change is good and we need more movies like this

didnt have plans to watch this at all but my grandma wanted to and i dont regret it at all i luv kath always n forever, her acting is amazing as always i think this is the first time i've seen anything starring alden and he's so charming and he played his part so well also the story was really nice and i love how ambitious kath's character was and how mature they handled their relationship all in all it was great

i'll be the first to admit that i dismiss kathryn as an actress simply because 1 she is half of the kathniel love team and i just find them so cliche and the typical pinoy media play just doesn't do it for me anymore 2 i gave her and daniel a chance went i watched the hows of us with friends last year and i spent the whole time cringing and regretting my decision to be there 3 i prefer jadine because i feel they are more genuine and, basically, just more real i don't dismiss the entire filipino entertainment industry, fyi got dragged into this with friends i had low expectations given my last movie experience with kathryn, but i gave it a chance because daniel wasn't in it and i thought maybe it would be a little better somehow i like alden, but i didn't really know how his acting chops were i was pleasantly surprised by how the film turned out the plot was honestly a bit predictable but it generally somehow felt more real and refreshing than other filipino rom coms i appreciate this very much, given the number of stereotype filipino films coming out in the last x years alden was great, and i look forward to his next projects i'm sure he'll get more offers after this his pairing with kathryn, i'm sure, has done wonders for his career since this came out i still think she has a lot of growth maturing to do in terms of her acting my preference, at least , but seeing this film really changed my opinion of her at least half of it, i suppose definitely still prefer jadine, and definitely won't be voluntarily watching out for whatever she does next, but she has one less hater in me

refreshingly charming, hello, love, goodbye offers a little something new it is hard to come up with a good romantic drama for a new love team but cathy garcia molina didn't seem to have a problem creating a new tandem philippine movie goers would root for set in hong kong, domestic helper joy played by kathryn bernardo works her way to get a visa to leave hong kong for good by taking multiple jobs just to get by she meets a charmingly cute bartender ethan played by alden richards during the first night at her new job and the two manage to become friends and obviously boyfriend and girlfriend although it still had the usual formula, the chemistry kathryn and alden shared on screen was worth the watch and is a reason to give this movie a chance

extra half a star because kathryns scenes reminded me of my mom and dad always saying yes to my wants and needs when i know damn well earning money in the us is not easy things i liked 1 showed the struggle of ofws in hongkong it was honest true to life joy and ethans family stories deserve their own movies i wish they were explored more, especially on joys story loved the comedy the beauty pageant was the highlight except the fatshaming part, meh filipino humor i loved how we could the smiles of the ofw extras from the beauty pageant scene maymay was amazing in that scene too jdjdks4 fresh loveteam i think cgm tried to make the lines come off as iconic as her previous ones the bgm getting played repeatedly how ethan treated joy at the start of the film,,, making fun of her and acting like a cop when she was most vulnerable and scared it was not bad i enjoyed the film and i think i actually like it since i was able relate in some aspects of the film not the romance part for sure

saw this latest star cinema drama and i wish i could say i loved it true, its a marked improvement from the typical rom coms the studio is famous for but still, despite its spotlight on a subculture of filipino expatriates living as quasi citizens residents of hongkong, it is still saddled by the usual storytelling cliches and harrowing contrivances that makes the film less involving and feels a tad bit manufactured the movie tells the story of ethan and joy who meets in hongkong at a wrong time in their lives she is trying to get away from hongkong and live her dream in canada while he is trying to reestablish his roots and his relationship with his family in the island after a failed relationship in the us its a good setup but it was not unfortunately sustained when the narrative decided to give more time on cutesy scenes featuring the usual go to best friends that may be permanently engraved at every screenplay thats greenlit by star cinema bosses and i observed one very sad thing about the movie i understand that the intention is good but this movie seems to be telling us that families, at least in the vision of the filmmakers, are the modern day representation of talangka filipino mentality in this movie, they seem to get, however unintended, in the way of the dreams, ambitions and happiness of the main protagonists even if the portrayal depicts the age old child sacrificing all for family disclosure i saw the brilliant film the farewell one day before this film and i may have been unfairly influenced by it into expecting that all films could be just as good this movie was a quick wake up call that not all movies are good no matter how well intentioned they are
this is a i want to have a jowa after this movie type of film if you're into that watch this

hello, love, goodbye review hello, love, goodbye is a film about a domestic helper in hong kong her name is joy kathryn bernardo in her last four months in hong kong, she met a guy named ethan alden richards and at first, she is making him go away because she is finding money for the paper works to be submitted to the canadian embassy and not a friend or a relationship but ethan persevered and joy falls in love with him in this film, we can see the conflict in choosing between love or dream, their own conflicts as a character and the hard work and sacrifice of an ofw overseas filipino worker first of all, why are there many films coming out in the philippines about adult rom com i dont know why but all of them is a box office hit it is well and good that they showed the harsh reality of the life of an ofw as a family of an ofw, it is sad for us as big as forgetting to fetch their children at school to as little as forgetting to take the trash out there are a lot of stories happening at once, but they resolved everything at the end these stories are a gateway to show the main characters internal conflict not just between them comedy is on point just as expected with joross gamboa not too many and not too few, just the right amount of spice also, there are too many cliche moments, but it worked out well without me cringing this is one of the filipinos illness when it comes to films they are too afraid of just letting the visual tell the story they did not let the audience think instead they laid it all out for us i hope that they overcome this fear and let the visual tell the story im also glad that they used the original artists songs and not just cover it it sets the mood rather than someone covering it lastly, cinematography is meh, okay but i can forgive this one because they shot this entirely in hong kong with some parts here in the philippines overall, i give this film a 7 10 film can be improved by deducting some parts, cut down their lines in half and let the visuals tell the story although, acting is on point, i think star cinema can squeeze more out of alden richards cinematography can also be improved by using tripods, stabilizers and a professional drone operator some aerial shots are jittery this is your typical love, dream and family story but they added the hardships of being an ofw

i specifically love the beginning of the film of course kathryn bernardo is a phenomenal actress and she immediately caught the audience's sympathy a loving daughter and reliable older sister ethan, on the other hand, is on the other end of the line a cute bartender with flings and hook ups on hand what happens when he met joy although it does have some sappy 'romantic' scenes and lines that i felt like sinking to my seat due to undeniable discomfort, this is indeed a romantic movie for everyone and cliches are not cliches if they never work anyway, the movie is good both actors have great chemistry but then again, i think kathryn bernardo could fit well with anyone alden richards has never been more handsome in my eyes of course, the funny bestfriends for mere comic relief kakai bautista is hilarious to no surprise 5 star para sa pintong padabog na isinara pero walang tunog

i love the sincere portrayal of the specific ofw experience of domestic helpers in hong kong the romance wasn't new ground, but still relatively mature within filipino sensibilities but the nail in the coffin for this film the tears wouldn't stop flowing as i thought about my tita in france who lives her life pretty closely to joy's

don't we all need cathy garcia molina's magic once in a while this latest offering has that extra special something alden richards and kathryn bernardo have chemistry for days and it didn't feel like they had to work extra hard to show people they have it the support cast was one of my favorite aspects of this movie from the friend group, to the family members and to the exes maricel laxa i live they swing for the fences and delivered natural performances the plot was nothing new, but it's really the pinoy experience in hong kong and how these performances stood out that really made adore the film more

a surprisingly good but honest filipino movie about the women who move to hong kong to find contract work in the hopes of getting permanent residency, but are unable to fully realize their dreams before then it's a story about hope, sacrifice, and ultimately finding that little ray of sunshine that can make it all bearable this is a pretty heavy handed movie that can teach a lot, but also comes with a lot of positivity

i didn't expect to like the movie this much, yet here we are it deserves all the praise it's been getting some dialogues felt a bit cliche and that acting direction in one scene felt too calculated but the two leads were still great, nonetheless kath and alden played their characters with endearing wit and charm, as their oddities make their interactions raw and believable what i really like about hlg is that as it goes along it feels riveting on a simplistic scale, it becomes expressive of our own feelings the theme is on the idea of love almost didnt work for me , but the direction pulls in the audience through its characters i am every bit of ethan and joy i work overseas but i have so much to be thankful for that i am not a breadwinner, no responsibilities aside from myself and i have a job that i wanted for myself movies are indeed powerful this made me more appreciative of the life i have now its good and a privilege, therefore i should not take it for granted

once again, we are reminded of the diaspora of filipinos or ofw's to well off countries such as hongkong and canada to look for better paying jobs, no matter what these jobs are it is sad because of the extreme difficulties encountered by the ofw's at the same time, i feel thankful that there are jobs and income to support the families back home joy's work in hongkong is hard her pay is reduced, she gets a part time job and runs from the hongkong police because of it in the middle of this, she sends home money to the philippines and finds a friend, ethan happiness finds its own source and with joy, it is in the central park where all the kababayans provide comfort to one another in the middle of a foreign country with an alienating culture it is also in ethan whom she fell in love with the movie is well directed and masterfully portrays the lives of domestic helpers salute to cathy garcia molina the script is tight and romantic which clicks with the filipino audience when you talk to strangers, there is no judgement and i love you witty remark to mean stay away finally, kathryn bernardo acts very well, she is the next bea alonzo as for alden richards, with his handsome face, he can go places in the film industry
walangya, ang ganda

letter grade a masterpiece this is genuinely the biggest surprise in cinematic history for me now, this might seem utterly ridiculous, for me to call this film a masterpieceand of course, it really isntbut man do all the positives about this film outshine the very small qualms i have about this surprsing, genuine, and heartfelt filipino romance i really dont know if its because i was only very slightly intoxicated, or because im a 20 year old gay filipino in a wonderful relationship with my oh so sweet and loving brazilian boyfriend, or the chemistry of alden and kathryn, or the admittedly cheesy but so emotionally charged well weitten dialogue, but this film this film has made me cry more than any other film ive ever seen more than my ultimate favorites, lord of the rings, cloud atlas, spirited away, cinema paradiso, boy and the world i literally had to turn away from the screen and bawl on my boyfriends shoulder in the cinema when that last conversation in the pier between ethan and joy maybe its all of the reasons ive lifted above or maybe this film is also just alright if i revisit it in a while by all means it is definitely not a more technically outstanding film than any of my other favorites, but man id be lying if i said this film didnt touch me to my core what a solid, beautiful film from cathy and such nuanced, magnificent performances from alden and kathryn im glad this film exists definitely my new favorite filipino film, overtaking that thing called tadhana by miles

alden richards character, ethan, is pushy, creepy and problematic he will continue sending friend requests even if joy declined several times already he will make the radio station talk about joy in public without her permission he will use another phone to text joy anonymously he will act like a police even if joy is weeping out of fear he will squeeze through inside a small room knowing that joy will be uncomfortable he will continually send need a friend today it almost gave me the same queasy feeling of the stalking problems i saw in kita kita and the french film amelie hello, love, goodbye is at its best when it tells the story of kathryn bernardos character, joy in some ways, the film manages to outdo similar mainstream filipino romance films because of kathryn bernardos stunning performance and the earnest depiction of ofws overseas filipino workers bernardo, whose acting holds the film together when it was falling apart, effectively evokes a palpable sense of weariness, discontent, and eagerness to alleviate joys situation actually, i can do without the la la land love story if the social commentary was strengthened and expounded more in a similar vein with sunday beauty queen, the film resonates with filipinos because of its sensible portrayal of what it is like to work abroad in a job you are overqualified in sure, this is how cliche ridden mainstream filipino romance plays out but how i wish we get movies that transcend this generic romantic stratagem

filipino romcoms just cant shy away with all the cheesiness but as a soon to be ofw i feel like i related to kathryns joy too much in a way that i have to chase this dream its all or nothing so this movie really spoke to me in that aspect

your typical troubled boy falls for a bright young girl themed romance a walk to remember a grease a say anything cathy garcia molinas hello love, goodbye discovers puppy love in its purest form it has plot and spiels topped with cheddar, mozzarella, parmesan, cottage, and blue cheese pairing kathryn bernardo and alden richards is a genius move this film showcased how good actor each of them is of course, we do not forget the supporting cast because they added extra entertainment and drama the movie never failed to give a sense of claustrophobic feeling of alienation and loneliness in a developed world the very reason why i think portrayal of maymays character was so realistic it is a good movie with great acting, average screenplay, and story topped with layers of cliches from the romantic drama genre

my twitter review the love story of hello, love, goodbye 2019 couldnt be more formulaic, although i wont dismiss its sad factor, but i really couldnt care less for it after the movie ended what the movie successfully conveys is the sacrifices people make to have a better life, to make ends meet, even if it means being away from the people you love the family aspect of the movie really got me, its the subplot that actually made me cry the plight of ofws in this film was executed very wellsensitively, with a lot of heart it made a good depiction of how families want to be together but cant, the pain and consequences of being away from them, dreams that have to be put on hold and the resilience of ofws i loved the movie because of that aspect my facebook review i have to admit that the love story of hello, love, goodbye 2019 didnt charm my socks off please dont attack me what i loved about it though, and where the film actually succeeds, is its depiction of the life of overseas filipino workers ofw it was executed very wellgrounded, sensitive, full of heart it showed how resilient filipinos are and how we find humor in everything that in any way that we can, we always find create families when were away from our own the film conveys how sacrifice can be selfless and also selfish selfless in the aspect of going away from your loved ones and braving a new world alone to make ends meet and eventually have a better quality of life also, that sacrifice can also be selfish, but not the bad kind i hope you get it , when it comes to choosing yourself, choosing your dreams instead of always trying to make the people around you happy the values of this film resonates, especially in every ofw family, how families always try their best to be together albeit it might not actually happen or whenever it does, its going to be a long, long time that in the end, and this might sound corny, love transcends loneliness, fear or hardship my favorite scene would be when kathryn, kakay and their other friend were watching vilma santos iconic speech in anak and kakay sobbingly asks, ang pagmamahal ba sa sakripisyo lang naipapakita sacrifices are not requirements in love we dont have to sacrifice anything just to show someone we love them but we do it because thats how we try to make it work with someone we love and its necessary

lahat ng gusto mo sa buhay, puwede pa rin, you can be more hello, love, goodbye is one of the great filipino films i have watched this 2019 i really love the way this movie portraits filipino values of people working in hong kong for their families pursuing your own interests ambitions away from their loved ones while also considering your family's immediate and important needs is one of the most difficult sacrifice everyone can encounter this movie really thought me how to prioritize yourself more and to support each other's back when it comes to achieving your goals for joy and ethan, distance doesn't matter as long as the roots of their relationship were strong enough superb acting performance of kathryn bernardo and alden richards every lines they have delivered really struck me the drone shots shown in this movie are really amazing excellent choice of songs for their soundtracks job well done for the people behind this successful movie

the chemistry between alden and kathryn is quite surprising they were a shade of bomb in this film, showcasing their stunning performances i did like the first half of the film but it sort of lost its flavor on the latter part because of the catapult from one feel to another the concept of the film is rather generic but it was overpowered by the provoking realities it laid out that ofws in hk experience nevertheless, hello, love, goodbye is a fun and feels ride in the face of its flaws

i cried way more during the scenes relating to jobs and dreams than the scenes relating to love, so i think that sums up how life is at the momenton an unrelated note, there were parts that i was questioning unsure of but im ultimately proud that there are more stories abt ofws that are being presented in the mainstream i hope we continue to do better

for the first time i watched a kathryn bernardo movie in the cinema, since i'm not a fan, and i must say it did not disappoint me the movie is a great depiction of the ofws in hong kong, particularly the domestic helpers, through a romance film bernardo did great in this movie playing a domestic helper named joy her character was well developed and mature and bernardo was able to fully portray it with finesse as you watch the movie and joy's development you'd feel like you're watching the true pains and hardship that our fellow domestic helpers go through with their work and life in hong kong which i think is when the movie is at it's best as for the romance part of the movie i did enjoy the on screen chemistry of the two leads and how they went through although their story is not as strong as joy's personal story alone richards is fine as the opposite of bernardo although i do cringe whenever he needs to deliver the cheesy taglish lines which i really don't like in most cathy garcia molina movies especially that the way those lines was written in the script, it's just that it did not matched with richard's character ethan overall i did really enjoy this movie from start until the end even though there were some low parts of the movie you can overlook those and find the movie enjoyable and will be happy to recommend it to anyone to see

hello, love, goodbye is another landmark on cathy garcia molina's illustrious filmography while it may not be her best movie, she sprays her piece with hints of realism, grit and realities on the backdrop of being a overseas worker all the while, she brought it with some weight and optimism that makes it stand out from her recent movies, even though the tone seems derivative from them it all works because of the performances of kathryn bernardo and alden richards, who are able to carry the levity of their down to earth characters and their chemistry is surprisingly exquisite and wonderfully executed that their solution pays it off the rest of the movie is filled with neat cinematography, a good pace and a cinematic feeling and even if the rest of the cast fall on the usual entrapped cliches, it is bernardo and richards' rapport that makes hello, love, goodbye transcend to its audience it is one of those filipino romance movies where i do not hear an over the top shouting match that is at least an achievement

oh my gosh sksksks i am totally late to the bandwagon of watching hello, love, goodbye a month later and it's still showing in cinemas and i can definitely see why now the kathryn and alden love team is so fresh and charming it's a love team that's not cringe worthy and it definitely works as cheesy as it may be with their dialogues of love makes me want a love life jk but i like the message of how it's really important to find ourselves first and reach for what makes us happy in our own way because self love is a very important thing that we should all consider it's not bad to care for ourselves first it's not bad to be selfish even just once especially when you always give your all to others that you don't even leave some for yourself joy has been sacrificing so much for her family even having to work abroad as a domestic helper just to help in her family's finances that seeing her finding her happiness, finding her joy and thinking of herself as well is such a great development of character it helps to inspire each and every one of us to chase our dreams and to chase what makes us happy whatever it may be or no matter how dumb it may sound kathryn bernardo singing is a mood need a friend glorietta 4

great acting but same formula same female main character who's the bread winner of the family same loud and funny sidekicks teasing from the sidekicks but i guess i enjoyed it nothing groundbreaking to deserve to be hyped this much but it was alright the thing i liked about it was how the sad reality of being an ofw was shown and how kathryn bernardo portrayed being one very well it also made me realize the sad reality of filipino children setting aside their own goals to take what should only be their parents' responbilities, because of poverty it's really admireable at the same time you wish it shouldn't have to be that way

cathy grace molina is a definite veteran of the filipino romance genre, and with hello, love, goodbye, she might have just crafted her most culturally relevant, self aware, and individually contemplative piece yet at the very least, it is an authentic portrayal of the plight of the ofws but if it werent for the well written, organic romance between the two lead characters, played endearingly well by both alden richards and kathryn bernardo, and with bountiful chemistry to spare, goodbye may have fallen into the territory of cliched conventional filipino love story instead, it is a grounded romance elevated by heart, integrity, and reflection take this from someone who isnt exactly a fan of the sappy filipino romance film

never mind the sloppy hetero romance narrative but the way this film represents filipino domestic workers in hong kong felt so joyous despite labor conditions, alienation, the brutal reality of capitalism that permeates the lives of domestic workers theres a warmth and dignity in how theyre represented the pageant scene is probably my favoritecomedic beauty pageants are such a huge part of filipino culture lmao, and its easily the funniest part of the film sure, the film softens some of the grittier truths about working in the care sector, but theres still enough nuance here it gives well deserved visibility to women ofws in mainstream ph cinema also, the kathryn alden pairing slaps

works a lot better as a good ofw story than a romance one this movie does a great job of showing a grounded depiction of the struggles of filipinos working abroad, albeit the cheesy, overbearing and overpresent musical score and the obnoxious sound mixing whenever that cringey moira dela torre usong usong nasally hippie pacool voice song i love the band part of that song though gets played super loudly every five minutes i was surprisingly riveted by the first part but then it lost steam in the middle i didn't feel the romance between the characters of alden and kathryn that much, but i commend their performances it's good that it didn't have the conventional happy they got together or got engaged or married ending

but this one, the highest grossing philippine film of all time, was the exception i'm really glad that i have finally seen this it was truly heartfelt and emotional well, i guess for me 'cause when you grew up with overseas working parents and became the guardian of your 4 younger siblings at the age of 14, and now that you're an ofw yourself, you just know you get to empathize with the plight of the ofws, and as you get fully immersed with joy's character, you can no longer stop crying i so love kathryn bernardo, so yes i actually plan to study for a master's degree soon, so i'm starting to write a concept paper regarding the situations of the ofws here exploring their social conditions, and the stigmas and prejudices they are being confronted but if things won't turn out the way i want it to be, at least i get to do something really fulfilling on my part pano naman ako i love you all but, what about me you can call me ambitious, but i have dreams bigger than this

kathryn bernardo and alden richards, troopers of this pinoy rom com industry, churn out career best performances held by their own individual wits and charms, and not by whatever makes this weird fish out of water out of country plot ticks, which at times does seem to be some oddly manipulative crushing stalking maneuvers on ethan's behalf but as an immigration emigration story goes, hello, love goodbye weaves around its complexities more deftly than most love overcomes displacement, but it doesn't vanquish it, even in the most heart stricken princess stories

leave to pursue your dreams, or stay for the love of your life this is the question that hello, love, goodbye asks us this latest offering from cathy garcia molina, best known for her filipino romantic comedies, is set in hong kong molina sheds light on the experiences of filipinos working overseas by following the story of joy and ethan, two overseas filipino workers ofws we see their lives unfold through the eyes of joy, a hardworking domestic helper whos trying to save money to move to canada as a nurse, and ethan, a bartender trying to find his motivation in life hello, love, goodbye stars two of the philippines biggest names from the two of the biggest loveteamskathryn bernardo from kathniel and alden richards from aldub whats also surprising is that bernado and richards are from rival television networks in the philippines, its common for actors to be signed to one network exclusively their performance in hello, love, goodbye proves that once in a while, it doesnt hurt to break out of your loveteam to grow as an artist in hello love, goodbye, bernado graduates from her teen roles and blossoms into a dramatic actressa total transformation from her child acting daysin a tour de force performance richards rises to the challenge and exhibits his versatility as an actor, proving why hes one of the countrys matinee idols to get into their roles, bernardo was separated from the cast to better empathize with joys feelings of isolation after just a week of filming in hong kong, she wanted to go back to the philippines richards, on the other hand, lost almost 25 kg to play ethan molina is notorious for her strictness with the artists that she works withbut its paid off as they are all household names, and her films have been blockbuster hits hello, love, goodbyes story is not new, yet it provides us with a unique perspective of the realities of being an overseas worker the film tears away the layers of the ofw experience with sheer intensity shifting away from showing the employee employer relationship found in other films about ofws, molina brings her focus to the ofws themselves, and their families back home read the full review here https www

i love the sincere portrayal of the specific ofw experience of domestic helpers in hong kong the romance wasn't new ground, but still relatively mature within filipino sensibilities but the nail in the coffin for this film the emotion wouldn't stop flowing as i thought about my tita whos life pretty closely to joy's where she came to america as a worker to work to send money back to her family and then fell in love the movie leans in to the novela aspect just enough while keeping its feet on the ground but the real star here is kathryn bernado who soars in this movie she is a star
good soundtrack

hello, lovedo you remember when i told you to watch the trailer of this you said that their story are like ours, but it will be much better because we can decide the ending my friend even told me that we should see this because she was reminded about us now i get it to be perfectly honest, what we did was a gamble i was supposed to transfer my love letter to you in a scented paper we were supposed to see each other tomorrow i was about to post a picture about us on instagram i was supposed to introduce you to my family and friends ethan of my life, i told you multiple times that i wasn't ready, but you keep on and i let my guards down i told you many times that we can't, but you made it seem possible i told you that i am going away and that, you're willing to give up everything for me i told you that you cannot make me choose about you and my career, but i was going to tell you that maybe i can compromise however, you didn't i think we both knew that we are both throwing away our lives to the uncertainty of us you said, let's give it a try and take a risk little did you know that i've already given a part of me for you i'm not mad i promise i've seen and heard those before i thought maybe this time, it'll work hands down, it didn't thank god it didn't i'm trying to be happy now even though i'm still hurting i just wish that we shouldn't have made those plans together because it is true when i told you that you make me happy and that everything will make sense with you i'm sorry if i have ever hurted you if my friends would ask me, i will tell them that i did not regret meeting you because you deserve all the love i will pray for your happiness and health i hope you're not skipping meals or burning out too much from work i also hope you get yourself checked and lastly, he misses you so much please, love i love you love, joy

10 minutes into the film and i am already teary eyed hello, love, goodbye is the film that is sure to be successful it stars actors that has a huge fan base and the storyline is centered on love especially, cathy garcia molina was directing it one more chance 2019, i feel like but, its different the film made sure to maximize their time abroad by shooting in different locations also, they highlighted it in a way that the scenes are almost always outside the team guaranteed that once the movie is seen, the audiences will be transported to hong kong as well second, aside from love, the movie dwells on the topic of work how ofws work themselves to the bone and how they survive on a day to day basis kakai bautistas role was the most impactful for me as an ofw she might not have as much lines at kathryn bernardos but when she says it, it rings true lastly, the feministic principles of joy, the heroine there might be a trend of feministic heroines on cinema lately like nadine lustres on never not love you but it still is special the way joy was written was phenomenal the dialogue was on point, the justification is there and the way the character grew was understandable her line of how the emptiness inside her will never be filled by romantic love alone was poignant overall, the movie is great as it arises discussion amongst its viewers are you a joy or an ethan
best and favorite kathryn acting performance to date also, the scene where joy and ethan were on the mountaintop overlooking hk and joy tells ethan that she's scared i felt that great ending as well

the story of the film depicts the life of a breadwinner modern world which is joy, struggling over dream, love, and passion that she have these problems are common to be the obstacles of those who has the responsibility of taking part in raising a family where the parents are both unable to in the film, joy has always been determined to help her family out of poverty that she forgot to live her life according to what she needs and what she wants when tested by the time and love, she has no choice but to let go of her personal desires and pursue the goal that she has set for the future of a better life with her beloved parents and siblings in the real world, we don't always get to prioritize ourselves when we have a lot of people counting on us, and during the process of chasing our dreams for them , we missed the moments where we should've live our lives according to our decisions since they will never cross our paths ever again

one of my favorite filipino movie, a story where love is not just what you give to someone but also to yourself marami din naman akong napanuod na movie ng gawang filipino, napaiyak,napatawa,nakarelate and other feeling na pwede pang ma feel dito kasi pinakita ni kathryn na we must never give up on our dreams dahil lang sa nagmahal tayo he gave courage to the other kasi alam niyang para sakanya naman, para sa magiging kinabukasan niya at ng pamilya niya

typical garcia molina flick that boasts a melodramatic script, unabashed with its sappiness i could've enjoyed this more if it weren't for the incessant spoon feeding on the flip side, kudos to kathryn who never fails to reel the audience in with her ability for emotional connection

surprised to see a filipino mainstream movie whose probably main goal was to introduce a new loveteam, and not be about a love story cathy garcia molina is a genius for love team baiting everyone into this movie that shows the sad realities of filipino overseas workers i'm glad my mom made me watch this on a saturday night cos i have gained new hope for the mainstream philippine cinema
i was truly waiting for this and the film really delivered kathryn's performance was on point the story, the cinematography and the cast gave a film that leaves a mark

this film is something that i did not expect so much from i'm a fan of the kathniel tandem simply because they work and it's something that we're pretty sure would be a hit so, when kathryn partnered up with another actor that is not daniel, i admit i was pretty skeptical i've watched a couple of interviews until i finally gave in and watched this movie the film started with an extreme long shot of locations of hong kong

didn't expect there was going to be a good chemistry between them at first, i thought they would only look good as siblings but this movie proved me wrong anyways, the movie serves as a window for us to see how the filipino domestic helpers abroad work really hard despite of all the things they left behind their comedic timings are smooth yet made me feel validated it's a millennial love but is pragmatic and not pretentious

my professor in introduction to global society class in dlsu just used this film to discuss migration here are some of the points we talked about after viewing the film migration has become less of a choice but a necessity there are different types of migration, such as labor for work and marriage, as shown in the film migration is driven by economic factors there is a cost benefit analysis whenever someone migrates ofws are perceived as well off just because they are in another country underemployment is common there is a certain identity maintained by the filipino diaspora there is always a hope to come back homenay, may uwi po akong broccoli at pansit
naappreciate ko yung acting ni kathryn dito more than ever

it's your typical filipino movie scenario where boy meets girl, they fell in love with each other, at the near end of the movie they have this big fight misunderstanding, and in the end, they either make amends and be together or they continue on with their single lives nothing new, the same old same old, recycled love story that has been told numerous times in the past though kathryn and alden were good in this movie, its the story itself that lacks a new perspective

what i love about hello, love, goodbye is its effective portrayal of the hardships and lives of ofws kathryn bernardo is really effective in her role as a selfless domestic helper and i'm surprised that she and alden richards has chemistry onscreen i like the montage in the film's opening sequences and bernardo's opening narration nevertheless, this film is still good but nothing still beats milan when it comes to showcasing ofw hardships and trials abroad claudine was excellent there and i think that it's a masterpiece

however, what made this different is how the story revolves around on dreams and choosing to grow together even when apart from each other at first, i found the alden and kathryn team up quite odd and don't fit well but as the film progress, their chemistry blossoms and the dialogues between grow on you kathryn definitely carried the film and it felt as if alden is the support that completes the film with her the overall heart of the film is pretty much there and makes this stand out from the rest of the star cinema rom coms in the 2010s
film drama romantis terbaik tahun 2019 imo most definitely in my top 10 list

hello, love, goodbyegarcia molina's latestis overstuffed, overscored, and relies too much on unrealistic dialogue to bring its story to life yet i was so smitten by it, like my heart is going to burst at any moment
it's so refreshing to see kat with someone other than daniel alden in this movie is a revelation the chemistry of the leads is impeccable i was bawling

best part of the film was the cinematography and how it actually uses hong kong and its streets, buildings etc as a storytelling element and not just promo for the film solid shots and color grading the plot was refreshing considering the generic romcom pinoy film the writing was good but it wouldve been better with less of the cheesy or fanservice type stuff solid acting and interesting and entertaining characters reminded me of kita kita but 10x better

the acting was chefs kiss the score was perfect the screenplay slightly corny but on god would make you tear up i could relate to joy i would, in a heartbeat, choose my dreams for once over a guy who planned it all out for supposedly the both of us

hello, love, goodbye catapulted itself as not only the highest grossing filipino film of 2019, but also of all time unlike previous title holders, this acclaim is well deserved because the film is actually good two overseas filipino workers ofw , joy and ethan, meet in hong kong and fall in love however, joy is planning to leave the city soon to pursue her dreams elsewhere meanwhile, ethan is about to become a permanent resident and is at the cusp of building a long term life there whats most notable about hello, love, goodbye is how it immerses us into the ofw experience the daily hustle, the homesickness, and the impermanence of it all not that the story is any different from anak or sunday beauty queen, but the film managed to go deep into the lives of domestic helpers and hong kong residents with so much authenticity and breadth and then theres the pairing of kathryn bernardo and alden richards, which propels the films dramatic stakes to even greater heights both are completely believable not only as lovers, but also as people trying to make their families proud the films overarching theme of chasing after your own ambition will surely resonate with everyone that being in a relationship doesnt mean that you have the same goals in life and that ambition is a personal thing every once in a while, we get a star cinema film that breaks out of the rom com mold and superficial happy endings i am absolutely floored with how the film ended even more so that they didnt attempt to reverse the goodbye with an after 10 years epilogue

being a filipino working overseas feels suffocating, which this film manages to execute that feeling perfectly thanks to the performances of kathryn bernando and alden richards the reason why people love this film wasn't because of the romantic moments between bernando and richards, but because of how the film depicted the unglamorous life of an ofw

after bringing more misses than hits, it's safe to say that hello, love, goodbye is the film that finally gets cathy garcia molina back on her feet to once again captivate the pinoy cinephile's attention thoroughly as a celebrated contributor to modern philippine cinema with her iconic star cinema features from previous years, she seems to have lost her touch with her being inclined on quantity over quality style of releasing films molina must've listened to the critics because her 2019 offering is quite special for a lot of things all of which make it a solid venture into new horizons for the filmmaker that hopefully, she'll continue to explore to continue an exciting streak of films potentially started by this one if one were to take it a step further, it's also a bold film, really for what it shows and tells to the audience as a mainstream release that makes it slightly unconventional and powerful what makes it so is the strength of the discourse that astonishingly, marvelously overpowers that of the star cinema rom drama formula that molina has always gripped onto it seems to have came at an opportune time, too, considering the state of hong kong during the time of its release which makes it a film of considerable significance that brings enlightenment to a wide audience about the ofw experience overseas the film can work and be enjoyed both ways, and that's really where the magic can be found, tasted, and adored as a social commentary piece about the lives of ofws in hong kong, it's fascinating and moving specially because of how the characters of joy and ethan are written with specificity where the drama is stressed and is made impactful and so, that brings us to the other side of the film that makes the romance that they try to invigorate worth buying into knowing their stories that can pretty much be anyone's looking deeper into those two facets of the film, it seems like everything here works fine and well, and indeed it does that it feels like a charm so unbelievable in how it is conceived though the film may still fall under the trappings of cathy garcia molina's films, such as the sappiness of the romance or the movie like dialogue that takes away an amount of authenticity, they aren't huge hindrances to the film being well formed molina doesn't merely make it all feel like a star vehicle for kathryn bernardo and alden richards after all since there's meat given to the characters they play courtesy of co writers, carmi raymundo and rona co it may be unexpected, but believe it or not, the screenplay of the film is astonishingly rich even if the direction isn't as masterful as one would like it to be the actors really work from that, bringing great stuff for us to commend, absorb, and feel almost even with the flaws resting in it, there's no way for one to not be won over by what this film packs a love letter to ofws not only in hong kong, but all over the world who sacrifice themselves for love in different ways, it rightfully deserves to be seen and embraced as a new classic for the memorability of how it converses, which shows its profound dedication and respect to those it represent onscreen with immense accuracy it's honestly the kind of star cinema film that you'd hope to be made more often tempered, substantial, and resonant a film that knows how to reach its audience in ways that don't feel too compromised and feeble in their attempts

sobrang buong buo ung character ni joy at natuwa ako na nabigyan ng highlight din ang struggle ng atin mga kababayan na nagpapakahirap sa ibang bansa sana di lang napwersa yung half baked love story at feeling ko hindi pa din earned ni ethan yung growth na nakuha niya sa huling part ng pelikula

basically, konflik dilema kayak gini udah familiar sejak nonton series on the wings of love dari filipina juga , tema besarnya hampir sama, jadi gak terasa spesial lagi hanya saja, di sini kathryn bernardo unggul dari segala aspek, sedangkan lawan mainnya terasa sulit untuk keep up
as of now this is the top grossing box office hit in the philippines and honestly i'm not mad even if it was set in hong kong everything about this film speaks to most filipinos i highly recommend it

this isnt a groundbreaking ofw film, but it is a very specific one, and its truly the details that make it potent along with whats perhaps one of the most fully realised female characters in recent philippine cinema, brought to life by an impressive kathryn bernardo

isang nakakatuwa at nakakalungkot na pelikula na nakabalot sa isang klasik cliche filipino rom com na tungkol sa buhay ng mga ofw natin na nakabase sa hongkong may magandang mensahe at mga tema na maayos na nailahad simple lang ang istorya girl meets boy tas boy keeps disturbing the girl even if she blatantly rejects him already mejo hindi ko lang natripan yung ilan sa mga katangian sa karater ni alden richards pero overall tingin ko nabawi naman natuto naman siya sa hule at saludo ako sa ending dahil yun ang siyang nararapat at maganda ang sinasabi dito na sa tunay na buhay e hindi magiging perpekto ang lahat at hindi palaging happy ending pero ang pagtanggap natin sa riyalidad na ito ang siyang tama at makabubuti sa atinmahusay na inilarawan dito ang mga pinagdadaanan ng ating mga modernong bayani sa araw araw nila maski sa hirap sa trabaho ginhawa sa piling ng kapwa nila pilipino pagsuko gawa ng lungkot pagsisisi sa mga maling desisyon, pagsasakripisyo nilang dulot ng pagmamahal at sa hindi nawawalang simpleng kaligayahan ng mga pinoyhindi ko alam kung okay ba saken yung pagiging madalas na pagtaglish ng dayalog, siguro mas gusto ko lang na purong pilipino kasi nga pelikulang pilipino to pero dahil ganun din ako madalas magsalita dulot ng kasanayan e madali ko naman tinanggap tsaka nasa ibang bansa sila normal naman na ganon, mas magustuhan ko lang ng konte siguro kung pinanindigan yung pagkapilipino sa ganung pamamaraan magaling ang pagarte ng mga bida lalo na sa mga eksenang dramatik ayos din na ramdam na ramdam ang kemistri nilang dalawa may ilang istorya lang na hindi masyadong nabigyan ng tuon at hindi nabigyan ng magandang konklusyon tingin ko dapat mas binawasan yung mga romantic scenes kapalit ng mga yon pero sino ba naman ako para magsalita tingin ko lang naman yon ang titulo nga naman ng pelikula e hello, love, goodbye alam ko naman kung ano pinasok ko sa pagnuod netosa pangkalahatan e sobrang enjoy naman tingin ko ang pinakapuso ng pelikula ay nasa kanilang mga pamilya at sekondarya lamang ang kanilang pagibigan, isang kwento na karapatdapat na naisapelikula at karapatdapat na maibahagi at mapanood ng marami at yun nga ang nangyaribest moments para saken e yung mga solid na comic relief ng mga side karakters tulad nung mga linyang mader packer ako yung manager dat sakin ka nagpapaalam stuckroom at marami pang iba

ang choice para lang sa may pera choice is only for those who have money it makes me so happy this rom com is the highest grossing filipino film of all time cathy garcia molina obviously knows how to make a rom com filled with the genre's tropes make it sing turning it into a love story between two intergenerational overseas filipino workers in hong kong who are bound by the struggle to survive under late capitalism the sacrifice they made to leave their families for another country to give them better life gives ethan joy's love story more weight poignancy the fact that it mostly shows the usual places filipino domestic workers would go to in hong kong, trying to cram as much details stories about the ofw experience in without torpedoing the plot, holding off on the country's tourist spots until it mattered speaks to its priorities and goddamn this might be alden richard's finest performance yet kathryn bernardo is fucking fantastic someone in the third world cinema club podcast mentioned that it's fascinating to watch this now, since it was shot before the ongoing protests in hong kong it's like a time capsule from the point of view of filipinos with the typical star cinema sheen

typical love story cinema's in philippines are intoxicated with fresh in the sense that kathryn bernardo gets a new screen partner to play with in alden richards and that works out almost for the better, as her and daniel padilla are almost a tired married couple after teaming for so long the story focuses on ofw, filipinos working abroad, here hong kong, and the tough situation they face a they try and build a better life for themselves and their families, and how romance help ease the desperate situation still a pleasant watch

the right amount of kilig and drama can separate a romantic movie from the rest hello, love, goodbye is a romantic drama that surprisingly doesn't fall prey to the mainstream formulaic love stories we've seen in the past it's not peppered with cliches it's relatable without it trying too hard this love story of ethan and joy is a non toxic relationship that's easy to get behind the hong kong backdrop and the chemistry between the leads made this movie all the better for moviegoers like me who's long given up in the mainstream romance movies the industry has to offer, this is certainly a refreshing treat
