is it wrong if this movies spotlight on hong kong makes me romanticise hong kong more from the view of a foreigner the movie poster caught me but the synopsis made me watch it as i am interested in discovering more narratives of domestic helpers as an indonesian, i learned a lot more of filipino words which are surprisingly similar to my language, such as bangon and utang, so that was interesting and made me curious to learn the language as a nobody who is not qualified to give any critics on film but will do it anyway, i would say that this movie centres around the life of one domestic helper which is pretty illustrative but not of the domestic work itself it disentangles a bunch of issues which may probably be central to some women foreign domestic helpers if there is anything that i would like to underline is that joy helps ethan and not the other way round if you cannot see something as simple as that then i do not know what else to say except to recommend you watch the movie again this kind of movies that reinforces the idea that men are allowed to force the love out of a responsible, ambitious, and bright young lady just because that lady is too arrogant to love is just

this is a story that hits close to home because of my mom i dont know the details of what my mom went through working also as a domestic helper in hong kong what i do remember though is something she said in passing that she would cry every night because she was away from me i never thought of my mom leaving me in the philippines when i was younger as something easy i knew it was hard, i just didnt know how hard i respect and love my mom so much and knew she did a lot for me but this film made me see things differently that respect and love blinded me, it never crossed my mind to really think about what she went through and now to think that she did all of that for me fills me with emotions i cant even begin to explain im so thankful but also so sorry i just hope im able to repay even just half of what she has given me and she has and continues to give me everything

i read somewhere once that flying makes you more prone to crying but i think that even at ground level, this movie would have made me cry on the surface, it looks like your typical filipino romcom guy meets girl, one of them dislikes the other initially, the other person is interested and tries to win their affection by being both pabebe yet persistent, a montage ensues, and as much as one party tries to fight it, they eventually fall in love char i remember seeing the trailer for this sometime last year and wanting to watch it because it looked promising while the movie does fall trap to some of the cheesiness and tropes read ethan's backstory that make the aforementioned typical local romcom weak, it manages to bring a depth to its characters, including l hong kong itself, that usually escapes mainstream blockbusters this is exemplified in joy's character i've been a kathryn bernardo fan since grade school hello mara clara but this is probably her best performance to date we are thrown headfirst into the demands of joy's life and her routine, the pacing of which i really enjoyed duty to family, the dichotomy between practicality and passion, and the price of following your dreams take on a new meaning in her situation you can't help but root for her and if you're like me want to throw a shoe at ethan it leaves the viewer instead to decide how they feel about not just the characters' situations, but also the very systems that birth and perpetuate them glad i was finally able to catch it i didn't manage to finish the whole thing but am hoping to during quarantine

hmm, sounds like three words from forever straightforward as this title is, whatever the complications and heartbreak in cathy garcia molina's latest romantic tragedy, they can't be any heavier than the story that has to be behind kathryn bernardo not playing opposite daniel padilla no, i'm sure their marriage is as annoyingly adorable as ever, especially since this film doesn't set a good tone for them seeing other people, onscreen alone bernardo plays a free spirited domestic worker in hong kong, with a diverse network of friends that don't worry, filipino conservatives upset about an onscreen couple not being married offscreen isn't too diverse she naturally hits it off with a handsome fellow philippines expat, an ambitious bartender looking to lay some roots down in the city our woman can't wait to get the heck out of as the two begin to look to their seemingly temporary friendship to help them weather the hong kong hustle, it becomes clearer that they have ideas to spend their lives together, and extremely different ideas about how to as the title plainly tells you, this story won't work out, but it is charming, way to a fault this doesn't want to be just another , as it lives up to its title by methodically examining the process of a potentially doomed romance with the intimacy and draw of a prestige love story there's more potential on paper than you'd think, but of course it's all hijacked by overwrought rom com sensibilities, especially with bouncy pacing and gratingly corny, relentless music jessie q the average rom com viewer may also get bored with the runtime, so of course i find more compelling than the average rom com there's certainly a unique enough romance in the gorgeous, ever bustling backdrop of hong kong explored extensively as its own character this scope is more than enough to liven up this intimate love story there's nothing refreshing or challenging about this shameless fluff piece, but its themes are a little more grown up than usual, more frank about the chore of reconciling romantic interests with personal ones histories of failures and potentials for success are heavily debated and approached in this two hour dual character study, at a methodical clip that may bore certain viewers without the fallback of zanily colorful supporting characters they bring some laughs, and texture the personalities of lead characters who are spoiled by their own, more mundane humor and quite a few humiliatingly cheesy bearings of soul besides that, their motivations and relationship turns are thoroughly, even complexly drawn, and tightened under the solid chops and crisp chemistry of the beautiful kathryn bernardo and the handsome alden richards between the ready made claptrap and the meanderingly thoughtful romantic dual character study, the former pretty much prevails on grating music, style, comedy and melodrama, with enough entertaining sprawl in the lavish hong kong setting, more colorful characters and endearing flair, and enough real nuance in the characters, their relationship and the performances, to make cathy garcia molina's hello, love, goodbye a touchingly heartfelt, just as abrasively disingenuous romantic melodramedy 75 5 fair

with unrelenting chemistry and superb acting from its two leads, hello, love, goodbye turns out to be an outstanding romance drama film experience against the backdrop and introspective of our country's modern day heroes, the ofws overseas filipino workers specifically domestic helpers in hong kong, the film was able to bank on even more emotions than expected one of these domestic helpers is joy kathryn bernardo who has wants to leave hong kong and find a better life in canada as a nurse but unfortunate circumstances have prevented her from attaining this life long dream ethan alden richards is a bartender and has a few years left before he can be a permanent resident in hong kong both meet one fateful night and while they do not fall instantly in love, ethan's persistence eventually wins joy's heart but their polar opposite circumstances and dreams will make the decision to continue with their relationship a difficult one to make hello, love, goodbye does enough to make it one of the better romance drama films we have seen how it accomplishes this is by pretty much making outstanding work on the basics first and foremost, the central characters of ethan and joy were well written and well scripted both characters had deep seeded personal issues that were not only central to the film's main conflict but grounded and believable the script was mostly great having its fair share of emotional one liners and witty banters but we have to admit, it went a little too cheesy in some scenes beyond that, both characters had great actors and performances behind them that gave these characters much life and much justice additionally, the main narrative was well written it felt fresh and had a lot of unexpected twists, turns, and surprises along the way the ending was satisfying without spoiling much it also presented a basic look into the stark reality of the ofw domestic helpers in hong kong while it had some unnerving revelations about the domestic helper life, most of these have been tackled better in other films previously what surprised us most though if the film's cinematography it's a given that hong kong is a beautiful city to begin with but the camera work here impressed us overall, hello, love, goodbye is a great romance drama film worth your time and one heck of a dramatic film at its core source www

watched this for class, and we talked about the rift between mainstream and independent cinema in the philippines the opening sequence of hello, love, goodbye 2019 is almost exactly the same as the first few minutes of sid aya not a love story 2018 , as it makes use of a montage of the scenes to come, all while joy kathryn bernardo describes hong kong, and her life, and how she perceives love again, similarly with sid aya, the first part only follows joy as she lives her life as a domestic helper, then it pulls the then it all changed cliche when ethan alden richards comes in and pulls out some weird and cringe y pick up lines to woo her and funny enough, just like sid aya, the woman has little to no interest in the man this film almost masquerades as the usual mainstream filipino romance, with its structure and overall production it has invisible editing, clear visuals, and an upfront and chronological structure with exception to the first flash forward montage and a few flashbacks but where hello, love, goodbye diverts from the usual is in the complexity of its characters' struggles as its plot progresses she is almost drowning in responsibilities as a domestic helper, but continues to hustle harder and harder to provide for her family, and to keep her fading dreams alive ethan is a hotshot bartender who is secretly full of regret, as he previously left his whole life behind just to chase a girl he desperately loved joy and ethan's dynamic starts out weird, but their love reluctantly grows as joy comes closer to her dreams and as ethan slowly comes to terms with his past towards the end, as joy and ethan are arguing about their future, and what love means to them alden richards and kathryn bernardo's performances are strong and passionate in the later acts despite some very mushy lines here and there , and perhaps this is where the artistry of the independent film lies their performances and their lines are the things i pondered about long after the credits rolled this film definitely leans more towards the mainstream cinema the mainstream elements significantly outweigh its indie elements but, it has a certain depth and profoundness in the messages it delivers to its audience thanks to its good writing and performances it's far from a perfect film, or a film that i would consider a modern classic, but i can definitely see this being enjoyed by a lot of different filmgoers with different tastes, as it does have a little something for everyone and because of all these, it's clear to see why this is currently the highest grossing film produced in the philippines

there's a single aspect in hello, love, goodbye that makes it truly worth watchingits fairly authentic portrayal of the collective plights of overseas filipino workers ofw as a former ofw's kid, this one definitely hits home, and it's pretty much the same feeling i had when i watched sunday beauty queen i have heard a lot of stories about their struggles abroad including from my mom and dad the moment joy kathryn bernardo shouted i love you all pero 'tangina, pa'no naman ako was pretty reminiscent to that of my mom's sentiments about her experience when she was feeling down while at work it's really sad, and this one spoke so much to me and so, i'm gonna give this film a point for that however, other than the things mentioned earlier, everything ranges from being dull to borderline decent i have to commend bernardo's very emotional portrayal of a very emotional character she eventually ended up carrying the entire film, while alden richards, despite being constantly labeled among fans and critics for slightly stepping up his game, seemed a little stale see it for yourself then it's nothing new, so i had to endure it hello, love, goodbye would have been a huge knockout had it been focusing on joy's story arc it's the only thing in the film that i was fully invested in

a surprisingly affecting romantic drama about the large community of filipino domestic workers in hong kong this is something that has been recently explored as a more heart warming drama with oliver siu kuen chan and anthony wong's excellent still human, however here we have a similar situation but shown almost entirely from the filipino workers perspective and with a significant romantic plot through central character joy, who wants to be a nurse, but is forced into the domestic helper lifestyle like her mother, it looks at the difficulties and exploitation inherent in these worker's arrangements paid a pittance, and treated appallingly by their employers and the state, this film examines how they can be trapped into this existence and life, allowing them to send a bit of money home to family in the philippines that they only speak to via video calls, promising a reunion that will never happen there's an excellent movie in here, but the film stumbles significantly when introducing joy's love interest, barman ethan while it may appear like this film is going to be a standard romantic comedy, it's not really, and ethan's initial characterisation is straight out of a lunatic american rom com after being introduced by pretending to be immigration police and arresting joy, he's harassing and calling her constantly, that even within the constraints of a romantic comedy which this isn't it's a shame that the film goes down this initial cliched route, after introducing ethan's character for the next twenty minutes, because at it's core, and once ethan stops behaving like a lunatic, it's a genuinely tender and quite tragic film about a doomed romance, and about how filipino immigrants to hong kong are never made to feel part of society the films portrayal of both ethan's father and joy's parents is well done, and very sympathetic, which makes it more frustrating that they wasted so much time with ethan's initial character, when they could have skipped that and presented him as he appears for the last hour of the film it's filmed on the streets and alleys of hong kong, and all extremely recognisable and vivid, clearly made by someone who understands the areas, full of classic oh yeah, i know where they are moments this is mostly an excellent film, that's dragged down unnecessarily by the initial appearance of ethan made even more frustrating that they roll that characterisation back still, definitely worth my time, and a lot better than i expected but it could have been just that bit better

what always fascinated me was how this stands as the highest grossing film of all time in the philippines having an ofw centred story would definitely play a huge role in this benchmark, since the ofw struggle is a very real experience among working class filipinos theres a whole history behind ofw films that id love to look into further while im still studying honours so for me, it felt like an interesting exercise in comparing both localised and transcultural portrayals of a country i dont really have a right to comment on the way cathy portrays hong kong people, or whether or not this captures an authentic hong kong experience outside the ofw life, but this is also something id like to scrutinise more closely i think i can get behind why people would see this as above average, and despite it being an average experience for me, i appreciate the film for what it is i would love to write further about the films ofw narrative and transcultural elements, as they are both integral to shaping philippine cinema as a globalised medium ps watching kathryn bernardo sing badly has been the most cathartic thing ive seen all year

cathy garcia molina departs from rom coms in a touching tale of sacrifice and love in a city far from home leave to pursue your dreams, or stay for the love of your life this is the question that hello, love, goodbye asks us this latest offering from cathy garcia molina, best known for her filipino romantic comedies, is set in hong kong molina sheds light on the experiences of filipinos working overseas by following the story of joy and ethan, two overseas filipino workers ofws we see their lives unfold through the eyes of joy, a hardworking domestic helper whos trying to save money to move to canada as a nurse, and ethan, a bartender trying to find his motivation in life hello, love, goodbye stars two of the philippines biggest names from the two of the biggest loveteamskathryn bernardo from kathniel and alden richards from aldub whats also surprising is that bernado and richards are from rival television networks in the philippines, its common for actors to be signed to one network exclusively their performance in hello, love, goodbye proves that once in a while, it doesnt hurt to break out of your loveteam to grow as an artist an empathetic, authentic performancein hello love, goodbye, bernado graduates from her teen roles and blossoms into a dramatic actressa total transformation from her child acting daysin a tour de force performance richards rises to the challenge and exhibits his versatility as an actor, proving why hes one of the countrys matinee idols to get into their roles, bernardo was separated from the cast to better empathize with joys feelings of isolation after just a week of filming in hong kong, she wanted to go back to the philippines richards, on the other hand, lost almost 25 kg to play ethan molina is notorious for her strictness with the artists that she works withbut its paid off as they are all household names, and her films have been blockbuster hits hello, love, goodbyes love story is not new, yet it provides us with a unique perspective of the realities of being an overseas worker the film tears away the layers of the ofw experience with sheer intensity shifting away from showing the employee employer relationship found in other films about ofws, molina brings her focus to the ofws themselves, and their families back home the film strips down the glamor of hong kong, as we follow joy waking up at 5am every day, hustling through the crowded streets of hong kongaway from her family, never catching a dream she sits down on top of cardboard boxes on sundays in central and juggles taking care of her employers daughter and grandmother while selling power banks as a side job which is actually illegal molina blends drama and clarity in portraying these hardships, and most importantly, tells the whys joy, and thousands of other ofws, endure these hardships to provide for their family back homea message that the film strongly reinforces we watch as joys friend reminds her cousin to be smart with her money so she can have enough to send back to the philippines, as the same friend tells her father that shell stay two more years because they need the money making sacrifices is almost always a givena harsh reality if youre an ofw because you have a responsibility to your family back home this responsibility that joy carries is one that resonates with many other ofws but ofws carry out this responsibility at what expense similar to still human, which also featured a filipino domestic helper, joy has a degree in nursing in fact, nursing is a common degree among filipinos with the hope of working overseas for better pay than what they can get back home as it turns out, nursing is actually the dream that joy wants to pursue, and being a domestic helper is just a stepping stone to that goal then ethan comes into the picture while a movie following the plight of domestic helpers and ofws doesnt really need a romance story, the love story still has a purpose ethans character contrasts with joys while joy is hardworking, determined, and knows what she wants in life, ethan is a happy go lucky guy who jumps from one relationship to the next and doesnt know what he wants in life but his characters free wheeling life also echoes joys self questioning of whether choosing ourselves over our family makes us a disappointment, or selfish joy laments the lack of choice she has in life as the familys breadwinner, her family doesnt know what she has to endure on a daily basis a nursing graduate that cleans the toilet and eats leftover foodim more than this job, im more, and i want to be more, joy says surely, this sentiment reflects the many dreams of other overseas filipino workers they have dreams but they also have responsibilities that hold them back joy and ethans romance show the heavy burdens and choices ofws face on a daily basis even something as minor as buying a snack or not is difficult, because every dollar spent is a dollar you could have saved to give back to your family lovea common filipino phrase, libre lang mangarap, tells us its free to dream but joy and ethan realize, as they try to make their love work, that dreams arent free when you make a choice, you give up something joy and ethans mutual romance story mirrors the same sentiments that their individual stories have choices, responsibilities, and dreams perhaps thats the reason why the romance element works against the backdrop of an ofw story in this sense, hello, love, goodbye isnt just a love story, nor is it just an ofw storyits a story about finding yourself, and loving yourself in the process this universal message is something that will strike a chord with audiences hello, love, goodbyes message is simple give yourself the chance to do what you want, get back up from disappointments, be courageous enough to love and choose whether you want to leave or stay the film doesnt portray bernardo and alden as people to pityit portrays them as human beings, with stories and experiences that empower them to ultimately choose how to pave their own way for their futureswith or without each other

i found it a bit cluttered and tedious in the first half but it gets better, more focused and complex after the male protagonists family situation is revealed even then, i felt most of the time we were being kept at arms length from the characters close, intimate shots were so rarely used i like its very mature approach to relationships, though, and by echoing the ending of the sparer, more eloquent endo, it illuminated the ending of that movie for me, showing that by not pursuing his love before shes ready, the guy is showing commitment and hope, a willingness to wait it showed his character had grown, also its something anyone who wants to get somewhere in life needs these days, so its good that filipino films are promoting this value

finally, i watched the highest grossing filipino movie of all time as well hello, love, goodbye was on my list since its official release with the new pairing i took some time to get into the mood all my filipino friends confirmed to me that the portrayal ofws is indeed a very accurate one it was indeed frustrating to watch the everyday struggle and hard work of educated young people in minor jobs to support their family nowadays it belongs to the normality to support their families through migration its indeed a very depressing atmosphere and all the problems and concerns were well portrayed by katheryn bernardo in this movie she did an amazing job as usual but this time the melodramatic vibe really flashed me i have to admit that i had my doubts to see katheryn in a movie without daniel but all my concerns were for nothing the whole superstar casting and the successful capture of the ofws situation makes this movie captivating i really enjoyed the realistic view and the reality that hits the viewer in every scene the survival and emotional struggle is detailed pictured and i really loved it that the characters stay true to themselves, no matter how hard is life to be honest, the depressing reality clash were indeed very much needed and an eye opener for a foreign audience the movie promises nothing and stays true to itself like its main protagonists

not related to the film, dont bother reading every time i open netflix in our tv its always in her continue watching lmao i wonder how many times she has rewatched this on her own and she has seen it in the cinema with me too i dont know if its because i have siblings working abroad thats why she loves this or shes just a fan of alden lol like what most people have mentioned, ethan is the definition of creep and sadboi lol the worst combination also that december avenue song instantly triggers my fight or flight maybe if this movie just focused on joy and without ethans annoying antics lol... but kathryn and aldens acting are really good and im actually hoping for a reunion project really digging their on screen chemistry just some interesting observations hehe i love how philippine mainstream cinema like the highest grossing films is dominated by women and lgbt as it should , unlike hollywood which mostly caters to film bros lol but also the irony that we have the most misogynistic, sexist, homophobic piece of shit as pres the way many people here support movies that film bros might deem too feminine, i love that for us like if you go out on the streets and ask an ordinary pinoy any director they know, high chance that youll hear cathy garcia molina, joyce bernal, antoinette jadaone, which is the exact opposite in the international scene where names like lav diaz deserved tho , brillante mendoza, or erik matti are more recognized well isabel sandoval too but just referring to the ones based in ph well, at least female directors are popular amongst the locals haha unlike in other countries where the local and international scene are still heavily dominated by male directors anyways, overall i still enjoyed this but istg we really need tighter storylines and perhaps bigger budget for these mainstream movies lmao

sorry talaga, direk cathy kasi i first watched this on my laptop thru a google drive link ganda pa rin kathryn bernardo has really improved, her performance here aged well she really did well in portraying the struggle of our filipina dhs hong kong, so close yet so far it's a colonial outpost that serves as a microcosm of global labor relations tired, underpaid, overworked, yet cheerful, patient third world women on its busy shopping streets facing their haughty, cruel, and privileged cantonese bosses who pride themselves in their neocolonial, anglo saxon upbringing the story is really familiar to me i saw how many women in my family worked abroad and some in hk and faced such hardships to provide for their own families here i hope the philippine revolution finally succeeds soon

this is one of the best films of modern filipino cinema i would say especially in the field of mainstream media it's no surprise that the film is the highest grossing in the philippines i like how joy's character and how she narrates the film through her eyes i like how she's not ashamed to tell her job to one of her friends i like how she's so candid in trying to keep herself whole amidst the things that try to crumble her into broken pieces i like how she well portrays how awful and difficult it is for people like her to be steps closer in attaining her goals this is one of kath's best roles to date i also like how ethan made it a bit difficult for her to leave hong kong after falling into each other's intentions and vulnerabilities what's a bit problematic though is ethan's character especially in the beginning it could be a little offsetting if it were to be done to girls in real life with him being a bit pushy when a girl you like is already gate keeping herself from you but it's good that there was some character development from him going halfway through the film it's nice he understand joy has big plans to fulfill and he trusts they'll be together in time love is really the most complicated thing it makes you question if your own dreams are really worth giving up if you can have another one with the person you love but in the end you'll realize that your destiny is what your freewill desires anyway if dreams are worth fighting for, love can find a way to be a part of it in the end

when you love, all or nothing hello, love, goodbye is my first filipino film i've been looking forward to this one for a while i gotta say though, i think i prefer wong kar wai's portrayal of hong kong to cathy garcia molina's hello, love, goodbye tells a very standard love story that's been done numerous times before, and better a couple meets for a short amount of time in a foreign country, and then are parted by time this film is incredibly soap opera esque, and there are a lot of scenes with heavy over acting and some delicious scenery chewing the audio mixing is also all over the place the actors can usually be heard fine, but sometimes the music drowns out what they are saying during important scenes some of the dialogue is also really unintentionally hilarious, like the scene where a character is berated for opening a bar instead of becoming a doctor or store manager there are some genuinely sweet moments hidden amidst the saccharine sea that is hello, love, goodbye, but i couldn't help but feel that this movie is frighteningly similar to those inspirational romantic youtube videos that get roasted from time to time if you're looking for a light, modern pop romance film, you could do a lot worse than hello, love, goodbye it's silly, but sincere i personally struggled to care about this movie strongly, but i promise there are some really nice moments scattered throughout i think there is a really good movie buried in here, but it'll take some work to unearth it

theres a constant struggle among love, family, and dreams as filipinos, we already grew up taking this huge responsibility to give back to our parents once we land a stable job and earn something to sustain ourselves and the needs of our family we need to adhere to this concern because the breadwinners were sometimes deprived to live their dreams because of the unexpected weight of responsibility we carry once we earn a degree it took a while for me to process things and calm myself from crying a good mix of kathryn and alden their tandem is an interesting one

march around the world 2022 7 30 i, for some reason, thought this was a bog standard cheesy rom com, and i put it on my potential watch list for this challenge because i knew i had some others with kind of heavy subject matter and wanted a few lighter options in the mix too i'll be honest, ethan's initial pursuit of joy is maybe questionable, and judging by the most popular review for this film, a lot of people could not see past that, which is a shame, i think once the characters actually connect properly this is a really sweet and lovely romance and as much time as that romance does take up, it's not at the expense of joy as a character she is always at the centre of this story, which is about so much more than a really quite cute love story i wasn't familiar at all with the cultural setting here, but i think there's enough context for everything that it's very easy to understand the employment situations, as well as the family commitments, and all the stress and pressure that comes with that joy and ethan's situations are different but they're a result of the same social, economic and familial restrictions obligations, and these things hang over their romance the whole time, which adds a layer of urgency and also sadness to them both there's a scene pretty early on with joy on a bus, and she bumps into an old college friend, there on his honeymoon, and it's just devastating kathryn bernardo is quietly heartbreaking in that scene, and she really does centre this entire film and later when she realises that she's been working towards an unattainable goal for her family, and now she finally gets to have a choice of what happens to her but it's not as simple as she hoped it might be, i was so invested in her that my heart was simultaneously soaring for her, while also breaking there's one or two little things in here that keep it from being 5 stars, but if you can see past ethan's somewhat questionable initial pursuit of joy then there's a really beautiful film here

a good romance drama set in hong kong where the main character is working as a domestic helper to help her family back home in the philippines as the months get closer to her moving for new opportunities in canada, she meets a bartender also from the philippines and as they get closer, has to decide whether to stay or go while the romantic drama was a little too much for me in some parts, it was awesome to see a movie centered around characters representing the overseas population from the philippines, who probably make up the largest foreign population in hong kong i loved the non cliche ending and the characters were likable it is also the current highest grossing film from the philippines of all time, which is pretty awesome

i think ito na ang extent ng pagiging experimental ng star cinema, lol first and foremost, kathryn bernardo proved once again that she can evoke whatever emotion she wants from her audience she acts with her eyes, body language, speech tone, just overflowing with passion i don't quite get why every single major family in the film had a member who had some sory of disability it felt like an easy excuse to elicit sympathy from the viewers, which is problematic as pwds have been forever subject to being accessorized in films and tv however, alden himself did a great job in matching kathryn's splendid acting he was decent enough to keep me engaged played it safe on the ending of course, it had to have even a tinge of a happy ending because it is a mainstream film and lots of filipinos consider a film bad if it doesn't have a light or a positive leaning ending it was building up nicely to an emotional climax but the moment joy and ethan had that confrontation scene, everything that followed felt like an attempt to repair the sad atmosphere that it produced i wish the film maximized that misery and took a full on drama end maybe then it would have more impact the audience does not need to hear a full track while the scenes transpire tolerable, for sure kathryn carried it

a heartfelt romantic comedy drama set in hong kong following the story of joy and ethan, two filipino immigrants its not a new story, but it blends the hardships, sacrifice, dreams, love realities of a overseas domestic worker quite empathetically the pairing of kathryn bernardo and alden richards was so charming sweet hello, love, goodbyes message is simple give yourself the chance to do what you want, get back up from disappointments, be courageous enough to love and choose whether you want to leave or stay the film doesnt portray bernardo and alden as some people who need your pitybut rather portrays the characters humanely, with stories and experiences that empower them to ultimately choose how to pave their own way for their futureswith or without each other a warm satisfying drama

this film emanates comfort, uncertainty, and self worth and that is what philippine cinema should put out not hundreds of generic cringy ass rom com films joy, a struggling filipino dh, who has specific dreams for herself and her family meets ethan who doesn't exactly know what he wants a literal manifestation of the 'grumpy x sunshine' trope, and i'm here for it joy finds comfort in ethan, even if she isn't exactly looking for a relationship amid their emerging relationship, ethan finds himself filled with uncertainty as his time with joy comes close to its end he deeply hopes that joy will change her mind as he planned everything out for their future but this is where it gets tricky, joy has already made up her mind, from the start she knows what she wants, even ethan can't change her mind and i support and understand her all her life, she has put her family first, and this time she needs to prioritize herself ethan does not deserve joy's half self if she even chooses to stay, cause she will always have 'what ifs' and that would also be unfair for ethan in simple terms, joy needs to find herself to feel that she is her own person only then will she be able to give herself committedly to ethan, and he understood that in the end this is when two persons respect each other's dreams and are both willing to let go of each other to grow individually and come back when they're both ready alden kath kathniel, i still stand by this

a kathryn bernardo stan through and throughnot the first time i've seen this so i always knew ethan's character is so problematic, but i guess that's a point to be made so the development can have more depth a guy who's immature and foolish and always putting his heart above all else, learning that letting go is another form of loving when all he'd ever known is to go for what he can reach if it makes him happy, and a girl that lived her life so small and consuming due to the sacrifices needed to be made at every corner, finding the kind of love that presented her the choice that could be the turning point of everything in ethan, she found the strength to choose herself in joy, he found a love that encourages him to be more it was questionable and doomed from the start, but if i know anything about love, it's that enough of it can really be the euphoria you need in your darkest, heaviest days at the end, finding each other made them better and with just that, none of the love was lost

the first is with joy and her experiences as a filipino overseas domestic helper living in hong kong we not only delve into her journey of wanting a better life for her and her family, but we also get a glimpse of this particular subculture of filipinos living in hong kong, who have carved out a little community for themselves away from their home between poor pay, long hours of work, and shuffling through countless jobs and hustles to make ends meet, seeing these workers come together to host their own makeshift beauty pageant, or weeping together as they're watching filipino dramas on someone's phone while they're in the middle of illegally peddling retail, it's those small moments of solidarity that adds a charming touch it adds an extra dimension to this life that isn't just all doom, gloom, and abuse and sadly there's a lot of it to make you sympathize with their struggle they made sure to make ethan seem like such a bad boy who can get any woman he wants and they display this by his friends joking around about how all his flings are named after a day in the week , yet he drops them all for joy because i don't know actually maybe it's at this crucible where a bachelor who has no reason to like a woman who doesn't come from money suddenly becoming obsessed with her that people find truly romantic, but then he admits to later gaslighting and manipulating her the entire time towards the end but he did it for love that cute montage of them taking selfies all over iconic landmarks in hong kong while a filipino ballad lulls in the background, is supposed to ignite lots of warm feelings in the belly, but for those who didn't buy into this relationship, can feel misplaced the only part of the romance i liked were joy and ethan's friends cheering their relationship on others may see them as one dimensional who act as nothing but cheerleaders, but these filipino romances know how to make really damn great cheerleading supporting characters that makes you wish you had them in your life now if only these male leads can actually be decent guys for once

there's something deeply depressing about stumbling across a boy you loved in the past inside a crowded train, who's there with his pregnant wife and having to tell him i ended up like my mother after all and i kept wanting to explore more of her history and depth i honestly wish the movie was longer, enough that we could see her family, friends and their stories more they clearly have their own stories that are reminiscent of all the non chinese hongkongers who sacrifice everything to suffer in a foreign nation for money the opening montage is so good and reminded of kimi no nawa's and i loved that i could trace the geography of my country in this movie either way, this movie was so so good

hello, love, goodbye revolves around the lives of joy and ethan both are filipino workers based in hong kong joy is a domestic helper who dreams of working as a nurse in canada while ethan is a bartender who is waiting out his permanent residency just like how most romantic films go, these two characters meet, fall in love, then... life happens hello, love, goodbye not just a love story, its a life story about making a choice between love and chasing after your dream joy, as the breadwinner, works hard to give herself and her family a better life she also actively engages in her buy and sell business every sunday, and even takes on a second job at night as a waitress she desperately needs funds not only to send back home, but also to finance her dream of flying off to canada to practice nursing, her original course ethan, on the other hand, is on the road to redemption after letting down his own family he was supposed to have gained hong kong residency already but he left and went to the us to pursue a girl he loved one is burdened by her family while also committed to her dreams, the other tethered to the idea of making amends to the people closest to him, and a relationship is the last thing they need in their lives point of the story was about making choices, no matter how difficult they may be and she is partly correct choice is a luxury only the privileged can afford it is true that not all of us can have a fair opportunity in life, thats why when we had a chance we should make sure to grab it and used it joy, in the end, realized that she also has to think of herself first and made her own choices for herself, even if it means that she cant be with ethan and its not selfish to choose your priorities first, since no one can fully understand your decisions even they say so choosing yourself is not an act of selfishness no matter how many reasons you may have to stay and give up on your dreamseven if these include people you love the mostin the end, choosing yourself is still the most fulfilling decision you can do of course, if i am in the position of ethan, i will also do everything for joy to stay, but we cant control everything sometimes loving someone also means giving them wings to explore horizons of growth

a romance different enough from the formula to make it interesting yet close enough to keep it undeniably familiar the first third of the film was filled with much promise, dipping its toes on social commentary by exploring the world of filipino domestic helpers in hong kong in the films first conflict, we see joy kathryn bernardo deftly running away from police even hiding in the garbage this must not be her first time was this film going to have something to say about the filipino diaspora once it begins to introduce the romance, though, it left that promise to immerse deeply in the tried and tested formula which is not such a bad thing whats refreshing about it is its confident departure from two dimensional, well defined fantasy an attempt to re define the star cinema romantic film, as it were i once read about the star cinema audience s rigid expectation of their movies, that they enter the theater fully expecting their happily ever afters and their convenient closures while i disagree with this sense of non adventure, it is naive to discount this insight significant enough to define the film watching market for generations garcia molinas cache is exactly in catering to this sensibility the scene of ethans alden richards introduction is as jarring to joy as ethans character is to the film to be honest, i kept on expecting him to revert to some sort of savior trope in joys life all throughout the film, even in his turn as a toxic nice guy in a pivotal moment further in the story to her credit, garcia molina gave ethan the room to decide realistically and bear the weight of these choices consequences it was surprising how natural richards was able to play ethan the writers forced his character to say some purely cheesy lines for the sake of saying them as lip service to this twitter generation but richards was somehow able to pull it off and bernardo did well enough in her turn as the headstrong joy that i merely had to stop comparing her to nadine lustre and start appreciating what she was giving to the film the chemistry was there, too, in that i could see them pulling off a dialogue heavy romance a la that thing called tadhana, which is in no way easy to do those scenes where they were wasting time beside each other were gold if our mainstream romance is really shaping up to this mold influenced by the efforts of antoinette jadaone, dan villegas, sigrid bernardo, and others from the independent scene then im definitely looking forward to more pleasantly surprising, insightful entertainment don jaucian, how black sheep is trying to disrupt philippine cinema, https www

there have been a number of films about the life of an overseas filipino worker, as our country is unique to have a very significant population pursuing this route among these films, there are gems that stood the test of time, and probably influenced real life and further films, as we see in a scene in this film what makes hello, love, goodbye enjoyable is how effortless it presents the culture, the active and passive decisions, that ofws take, to fulfill their purpose while there is a wide cast of characters with their corresponding side stories, nothing feels misplaced maybe a few were quite less filling, the different facets and permutation of circumstances of filipinos living abroad, provides a peek to a rich tapestry for wider stories of these characters more than how these stories are told, as enhanced by the shot choices and camera movement that let you fall in love with the cityscapes, is the courage to not shy away from the route of the socially desired, mainstream choice until when though do filipinos need to be pressured to make these choices, to enter these circumstances

god, when will the philippines retire the overly persistent dude wearing down the uninterested girl with his charms this film kind of makes up for it with the sheer support radiating off both the characters later in the movie, but it, along with other well worn cliches, threaten to wear the movie down thankfully, though, it doesn't it's still very much typical pinoy romcom, but it's also one of the best examples of the genre there is poignancy, clear set goals from each character, and most of all, a lack of certainty in the end of their love story joy's young cousin doesn't overcome the hardships she faces as a newly minted domestic helper, but she does tap out and get out of them joy and ethan come together at a time in joy's life when she is just about to leave to canada in search of greener pastures hello, love, goodbye gets that it as a movie has experienced true life, and despite being cornier than most, it's got its finger on the pulse of the way people love and laugh, especially when time is so fleeting this is the best acting work on either of the two sides, kathryn bernardo and alden richards a change of pace brings out the best in you, i think

ive been putting off watching this movie for years now because when it first came out, several of my friends mentioned that joy reminded them of me and then i noticed that netflix is removing this title tomorrow so i thought why not hello, love, goodbye is yet another ode to our countrys unsung heroesour overseas workers, but with a more authentic touch it takes on new angles and anchors its narrative specifically to hong kong, which coincidentally happens to be one of my favorite places and the only country im inclined to visit more than once in my lifetime this film reminded me of my yayas my family helped to get to hong kong to seek greener pastures and my own relatives who took a gambit and flew out of the philippines to get a better shot at life as well it spoke to me as a fellow ate eldest sister whod do anything for my family, even if it meant doing so at my own expense hello, love, goodbye is an honest portrait of our culture and a reminder that we filipinos have a shared existence that transcends time and placefind comfort in that spoke to me on so many levels

somehow combines all movie character tropes possible in the typical pinoy cinema fashion but still had me balling my eyes outthis is truly peak pinoy cinema beyond the portrayal of a healthy relationship finally , i truly enjoyed the portrayal of dh workers in hk in full transparency and rawness especially with sending remittance back home as kathryn also to save money pag ipunan for her nursing agency to fly to canada domestic labor is one of the main sources of income for many filipino women both at home and abroad joy's situation is very lucky compared to other experiences i've heard of dh being abused and exploited by their bosses other than being a film starring kathryn bernado and surprisingly not daniel padilla, i wonder what power this film could've had on shedding light on the exploitation, rights, and working conditions of dh workers and the outsourcing image we have as filipinosanother line that truly resonated with me was when joy's ama reprimanded joy for abandoning her disabled daughter, annie, on the street joy's amma exclaimed, how could you do this to her, i thought u loved her this made me think about the complexity of love dh workers face in ur job description, you must love other peoples children, u care for them daily, watch them grow up, and essentially fill in this role of a parent to these children all while being miles away from your own family and often times unable to spend quality time with them for years until your contract expires to what extent to dh workers feel love towards the children they care for while simultaneously feeling guilt that they cannot be there for their own family or children one possible answer in resolving these complex feelings of love, guilt, and regret is by reminding yourself your sense of purpose in which most of these dh workers find purpose in their love for their family willing to sacrifice to put food on the table and support the education of their loved ones yaya is fantastic documentary that follows the life of a dh worker who in the director's, justin cheung's, words, helped build a family at the expense of her own

this is cathy garcia's redemption after a disappointing film, the hows of us i was very impressed on how they showed the struggle and working conditions of filipino domestic helpers in hong kong the storyline might be predictable yet it is straight to the point, and effective to touch the audiences star cinema might repeatedly used their formula for a romantic drama comedy film but they handled it properly the side story of kathryn's and alden's family are justified to be part of the story for us to understand their present decisions the friends from both sides are only present for comedic purposes but it can be problematic as it serves distraction to the real issue though, i appreciate the presence of kathryn's companions who are also domestic helpers as well, alden's pick up lines are so irritating and i am happy kathryn was not doing it above all, this is a breakthrough performance of kathryn bernardo as she matured to handle a strong female character and let go from her previous fragile roles this film proves that kathryn does not need daniel to be recognized as a great actress

i watched this film for my thesis, and i loved it its more than just a typical romance film because it also explored the struggles and plights that ofws experience plus, it delivered a beautiful message about dreams and why we shouldnt give up on them despite the setbacks we encounter ramdam na ramdam ko yung emotions ng story, and ang galing nina kathryn at alden dito they gave such moving performances however, as much as i love this film, there are some things i didnt like too many subplots, and not all of them were done well as the film focused on joy and ethans love story, many subplots got overshadowed and lost their emotional impact the one with joys mother towards the end wasnt even built up properly i appreciate the representation but these disabled characters were just... there and why is it that both of joy and ethans fathers were disabled i feel like they couldve written the conflict without making ethan a red flag character without making him disregard joys dream if they spent more time on it, it wouldve hit harder and wouldve really highlighted mary dales plight as an ofw nevertheless, despite these criticisms of mine, i really love this film it made me smile a lot today

2019 ranked i need to write an essay about this movie for school, which is why it was necessary for me to rewatch this one the way i looked at this movie is that i appreciate the drama with regards to their hardships as an overseas filipino worker ofw than the...

it's like the romance drama version of the 2016 mmff best picture 'sunday beauty queen' so much respect for our hardworking ofws not just in hongkong but all over the world you appreciate all the sacrifices they make and feel the longing and suffering they endure just to send money to their loved ones back home 2 the cast i've always been a fan of alden richards' acting skills and he certainly didn't disappoint i initially thought the role didn't suit him based on the trailer but he just proved that he's one of the best young actors around the supporting cast were all great from joross gamboa, cacai bautista and lovely abella these 2 were riotous , maimai entrata, jeffrey tam, jameson blake to veterans lito pimentel, maricel laxa pangilinan and william lorenzo to even the local hongkong actors but it was kathryn bernardo who surprised me the most she really has grown as an actress from her teleserye days since i choose not to see her movies with daniel padilla, i never expected her to be so effective and sympathetic as the young woman torn between following her own dreams over love i thought this was more of her movie than alden's 3 the soundtrack moira, moira, moira just hearing her voice in 'kung 'di rin lang ikaw' and 'ikaw at ako' gave me goosebumps and these 2 songs were the perfect soundtrack to ethan and joy's love story 4 the setting who would've thought that the busy streets of urban hongkong would look beautiful on the big screen kudos to the cinematographer joy and ethan mouthing them all off sometimes felt forced just for the viewers to remember and quote them when they talk about the movie nonetheless, ang pelikulang ito ay ma i really loved it

but now that i watched it again, i understood why this is the highest grossing filipino film it captured the hardships and realities of what dh filipinos experience on a subtly deep level the longing for more but you have to remain in that level just because there is a need to provide tbh, ethan and joys love story was not the main point of this movie it was more of a side story that helped resurface joys character of resilience and strength those characteristics were used by ethan as a stepping stool not to use it against her but to help her yes, there were some misdirects esp when ethan didnt want joy to leave and didnt understand her situation at first it was extremely notable how he didnt force her even though he knows he soon can provide and actually just gave her the best possible 3d2n tour joy could bring as a memory before she departs i love that he didnt stray her away from her independence it couldve went to a whole diff direction where they built a life in hk but, direk cathy made it a point to make sure that the viewers heard and saw what she wanted the movie to focus on not ur typical love story, so impactful and so realistic esp to filipinos

unexpectedly a success film in every aspect the story was superb and well written it is so relatable by giving highlight to the plight of our filipino ofws in hong kong with a twist of romance that is far from montage of chessy lines and scenes given with this plot about ofw, it is so relevant and relatable already to the audiences the lead characters shone on their own equally in the story the same as the lead casts justified their roles in giving a compelling performances that exceeds expectations this is a proof that you don't need love team tandems to produce a great movie even the supporting casts, they gave so much life to the story of this movie and they gave intermittent breaks from the seriousness of the main story hong kong chosen as a backdrop setting for the entire film was promoted fully here and went beyond by showing to us the ofw daily life of filipinos there this is a certified travel movie as well the shots in hong kong and its places were flawless and stunning i love that they promoted it not just a transit place which hong kong is used to be known but also a place to stay cinematography was commendable this film was actually close to masterpiece if it weren't for a open ended ending that i felt and the rest of the audiences were left wanting more this is highly recommended
